direction.raw_text: on the needle of a precision-weighted 33rpm turntable. It comes down, touches vinyl. The Rolling Stones "Sympathy for the Devil" purrs out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (40's) Sitting in a comfortable wooden chair, stares right through us. Lean, hard, in perfect physical shape. In this moment, carrying the stillness of someone utterly in balance. For all we know, he's been sitting this way for hours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Every man has a death that's right for him. Every one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to find a wall of photographs, charts, official documents. In the center A PHOTOGRAPH of a man, mid-40's, East-Indian, dressed like the billionaire he is. Dodi Fayed meets Bill Gates. THE MARK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) For every man, there's a way to leave this earth which is so right for them, it's almost as if they carry it with them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: over the wall. MORE PHOTOGRAPHS. The Mark escorted from a bullet-proof sedan by ear-wired men. Entertaining at a palatial estate. Magazine covers: "The billion-dollar lifestyle." "The new Playboy." ...passing over smaller articles: "What does this man do with your money?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) When the right death overtakes a man, there will be grief in those who knew him, but there will also be a sense of inevitability. Because they will know, that of course...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Statue-like, except his eyes which dart across the wall in front of him, making connections...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: speed by, a blur of color. But all we hear is the Rolling Stones' song. And...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) ...Of course, this was always going to happen this way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The SOUND OF THE RACE floods in as the cars blow by, revealing Bishop amidst onlookers, watching, calculating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Two cars TANGLE in a corner, SPIN to a stop, crushing a half-million in beautiful restored antique. The Mark climbs from his wreck, tosses his helmet, pissed. Bishop raises a camera, takes a picture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop at his wall again, this time actively engaged, working it. A picture of the Mark in his vintage car goes up, underneath, Bishop tacks a stats page: "Fatality in auto accidents by type of impact. Head on, Side rear,..." Off to the side, bank statements, cash transfers. Saudi Arabia. Chechnya. United Arab Emirates. Bishop tacks more photos up. The Mark, getting off a private plane, the Mark, playing Polo...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! A Rider SLAMS a ball forward, spurs his horse onwards, bearing down on the ball... and SLAM! Another Rider comes in from the side, sends the man crashing off his horse. The second man, the Mark, takes a second to gloat over his fallen opponent before CHARGING onwards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Bishop watches, takes a note on a pad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop keeps working, the wall completely covered now. Lists of possible deaths have been ordered, drawbacks circled. Bishop scans over various magazine covers featuring the Mark. One with a vintage hunting rifle slung low in his arms, unbroken. "American Dream or American Nightmare?" Bishop stares at this. Eyes moving over the wall, accident stats, a copy of a hunting-club reprimand... he's arrived.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop stands in front of a moving riverway, his body sheathed in a black slicksuit, backpack on. He slips into the water and starts to SWIM. We STAY with Bishop as he SWIMS HARD, powerfully, not tiring. Finally, we PULL AWAY, across miles of water, realizing this is what Bishop will swim without stopping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pair of ARMED SECURITY patrol a wooded shore. One lifts a pair of binoculars, scans the shore as BEHIND THEM, a form moves from behind a tree, blends into the woods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Moving fast, silent, towards a LIT STRUCTURE in the distance...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The SENSE that someone is in here with us...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: illuminates Bishop in a TINY, CRAMPED, COMPARTMENT. No way to know what or where. The glow, coming from his watch, illuminates his face, crammed and claustrophobic. An eye checks the time, the light goes out. Just the sound of his breathing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! CRACK! PLUMES OF SMOKE rise from the end of vintage hunting rifles. Game birds scatter into the air. Dogs BARK, tear through underbrush. MEN dressed in traditional hunting livery move through foggy woods, followed by STEWARDS. This is old school hunting, old school weapons. Camera finds The Mark, raising his weapon, sights... BLAM! A PHEASANT falls, dogs race after it. The Mark starts forward but is interrupted by his Steward reminding him to break his weapon as the other hunters have. The Mark pushes the man back, ignoring him, hurrying on. At a small distance, two unhappy private security guards follow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A soft BEEPING, almost inaudible. A low rustle of cloth, then the green glow illuminates Bishop's face as he checks the time again. Hasn't moved in HOURS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mark stumbles forward, over-eager to get to his prize. He's worked his way ahead of the field. The MIST has grown thicker. Human forms move on all sides, hard to distinguish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! CRACK! Guns go off around them. Dogs rush by. The Mark brings the weapon to his face... BLAM!! The shot echoes through the foggy woods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mark, pleased with himself as always, bursts into the lodge, gun over his shoulder. A round of APPLAUSE as his Steward holds up the morning's catch. He pushes on into the locker rooms as one security takes station at the door. The second emerges from the lockers, having just done his sweep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mark leans his vintage hunting rifle against the wall, opens his locker. He kicks off his boots, pulls off his shirt. Takes a second to rub his face with his hands. It can be exhausting being him. Behind the Mark, a locker door opens and closes. Like a ghost did it. He doesn't sense a thing, reaches for his weapon, accidentally knocks it to the side. It LANDS, HARD. The Mark WINCES, half expecting it to fire. But no. He starts to lean down for it when another man's gloved hands reach it first. The Mark smiles down at the well-dressed man crouched by the gun, a little confused. Bishop looks up, smiles back. He puts out a gloved hand. Before the Mark can consider, he's taken Bishop's hand. Bishop holds tight. The Mark's smile... fades. Even though we know it's coming, Bishop's actions are so fast and final we're taken by surprise. He PULLS the Mark in as at the same time he cocks the rifle's hammer, slams the gun into position, barrel pointed up and BOOM! The shot hits the Mark in the face, obliterates him, sends a plume of gore up against the ceiling. One, two seconds before the Mark's SECURITY rush into the room, guns lined. First sees the mess, puts a hand to his mouth. Second starts on the radio. The room is empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A vintage 1972 Shelby Cobra parked by the edge of the river. Bishop emerges from the water, pops the trunk of the car. Towel and large rock inside. He towels off, tosses the suit and the rock into his pack, pack goes into the river. He grabs a sweater from inside the trunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop gets behind the wheel, dressed. He checks himself in the rearview, finds a bead of sweat traveling from his brow. Wipes it away, irritated, and starts the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Establishing. A quaint local convenience store off a two- lane road, nestled amidst trees. Bishop's vintage car pulls up and he gets out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Door jingles as Bishop steps in, smiles to the GROCER, a friendly beefy guy in his 60's who checks the clock. 7:00 on the nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Evening, Arthur. Got your weekly right here. The man hoists two bags of groceries onto the counter. Bishop comes forward, sees the Owner's DAUGHTER behind the counter. 12, precocious, reading a dog-eared kid's book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Sophie. I got something for you, wanna see? The girl smiles, puts down the book and comes over. Bishop crouches in front of her. He puts out two empty hands, shows them back and front, then tickles one ear with a hand while the other "appears" a small daisy. The girl sees it, smiles... a little disappointed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just kidding. Bishop reaches into his jacket, pulls out the next installment in the kid's book she's reading: A series featuring a young female Harry-Potter like character on the cover: LUNA CROMWELL. Sophie BEAMS, takes it. A quick hug and she's back to her seat, opening the new book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you say, honey?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Bishop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're very welcome. And she's back into the book. Bishop smiles, a little sad. It was nice... but the moment's over. He stands and collects his groceries.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See you next week, Arthur.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME - EVENING A ranch-style compound, nestled in the hills. Warm, rustic, and inviting. Bishop's Cobra drives past the MAIN HOUSE, a large craftsman, into a BARN where he parks next to a collection of other beautiful vintage cars. He gets out, crosses the dirt drive towards his home. A STUDIO separate from the main house. Two horses graze in an attached paddock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME - EVENING Bishop's enters, flicking on lights. The home is beautiful, ordered. Everything a model of design and elegance. The walls are home to a collection of original and slightly sociopathic art. Lucian Freud, de Chirico, Zak Smith, Francis Bacon. Isolation, beauty, unrest...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop unpacks his groceries. Organic. Raw. Supplements. Vitamins. Nothing looks delicious. His fridge is ordered. Glass containers in rows, lightly hued liquids in each. He opens a can of Friskies, sets it down for a mutt-like tabby-cat who lopes over and eats. Bishop scratches her behind the ears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop flicks on lights illuminating the WALL covered with charts, documents, photographs of the Mark. He goes to a gas fireplace built into the side of the room, fires up the flames. A sideboard holds a collection of Vinyl Albums. Mint condition, collector. Fingers play over titles... Rolling Stones, Neil Young, Bob Dylan... The turntable needle hits Young's "Needle and the Damage Done." Music croons sweet into the room as pages, photos, everything goes into the fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . One photo in particular: The Mark, busy on the phone as a young girl pulls at his suit jacket. He was a criminal bastard, but also a father. Bishop stares down at the picture, consumed by fire, reflected in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop, running on a treadmill, full-tilt. A controlled sprint without end. The gym has all manner of customized exercise equipment. Weights, machines, a climbing wall, an infinite lap-pool. Bishop jumps off the treadmill, immediately takes his pulse, checks it against a clock on the wall, jots a note. Bishop, pressing weights. 300+ pounds. Reps over and over, Muscles HARD, STRAINING. In his eyes, almost a relaxed intensity. The rest of the world, turned off. Bishop RACKS the weights, LOUD. Immediately taking his pulse, checking the clock...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop sits at a small desk, plotting the evening's work-out in a book. He traces columns, enters points on a graph.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Doesn't matter how impressive the numbers are, they've peaked and are now starting their inevitable slide...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Staring at the book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishops stands in front of his phone. He scrolls through the last ten calls that have come through. They all read "McKenna, Harry." Over and over. Three days' worth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop eats dinner, alone at the end of a beautiful antique table. Hanging on the wall across from him, a vivid disturbing painting of three women.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . His food is a meal we might expect an astronaut to eat. Raw Spinach, a collection of supplements. He crunches through something that looks like cardboard, chews, stares at the painting. In his study, the phone rings. He eyeballs it, lets it ring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DEN, BISHOP'S HOME - NIGHT Bishop sits on the couch in front of the television, his cat curls under his arm, purring. Bishop flips channels through an endless display of over-amped human behavior. People HAW and WINK in the sitcoms, people YELL on the talk-shows, people CRY and LUST on the dramas. Flip. Flip. A news channel shows a PICTURE of The Mark. "Billionaire tech mogul dead in tragic accident." Two ANCHORS discuss...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...here's a guy at the top of his game. And yes there were questions about the money: Where did it all go. Were some of his friends less than friendly to the US? But in the end, it's not the feds who catch up with him -- FEMALE NEWS ANCHOR It's that age old adage that boys will be boys. These dangerous hobbies come with the risk of accidents like this -- Bishops punches off the tv, heads for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop pulls up in his car, looks up. Hundred of lit windows above him, lives going on behind each. He heads forward, the doorman holding the door for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop gets out of the elevator, stops in front of a door. Beat. He rings the bell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's open! Bishop pushes the door open, steps into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beautifully, warmly furnished. Sofas surround a living area, a gas fire flickering. Throws and rugs. Art on the walls, tasteful and human. An open bottle of wine on a granite counter top.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Over all the city, thousands of lights twinkle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll just be a minute. We catch a GLIMPSE of the WOMAN. A towel over her hair, wearing a skirt and a bra, crossing from the bathroom into her bedroom. Even in the small glimpse, she's beautiful. Bishop looks down at a coffee table. Magazines, newspaper. A picture of the first Mark's elaborate funeral.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry I was away so long this time. I had some complications... He turns. She's emerged from the bedroom. 30's. Long dark hair, damp from the shower. Buttoning a shirt, the curve of her breasts caught as she does. A comfortable, sophisticated air about her. Effortlessly attractive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have to apologize. I'm just glad you're here now. (BEAT) Are you hungry? She starts to move by him, his hand catches her arm and she is in his arms, holding him TIGHT, kissing him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. I just... miss you. I never thought I was going to be a "woman who waits." But I do. I wait for you. He nods. She breaks off, pours red wine in a glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were you in Europe? Africa? (BEAT) Was there another woman?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Liar. It's alright. I don't mind. (Suddenly shifting gears) I... I made something for you. She picks up a remote, fire up a large flatscreen TV. Hits a button. A moment, then an IMAGE flickers to life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The WOMAN, sitting in this same living room. She wears a long sleeve shirt over panties. Sips a glass of wine. Smiles warm at the camera. The silence of late night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you. Just got back from the weekend at the lake with Julianne and Barry and their kids. Their oldest is five. You'd like him. (BEAT) Everybody spoke about you, of course. We should go up there sometime, just the two of us...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : She reaches towards the camera and the image
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Another night, late. The WOMAN enters the frame, now wearing a stunning black party dress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (announcing, giggling)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: just got back from seeing the most boring opening at the Pierre Grochet gallery. And of course everyone's asking where you are and of course I made your apologies, but what I was thinking...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : She winks at the camera, happily drunk. Raises her dress a little, suggestive...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (WHISPER) Why weren't you here to take me home and make love to me...? She blows a kiss. Closes her eyes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Watching. Emotion breaks the surface. The WOMAN raises the remote. Turns off the image. Looks at Bishop. Plain, not demanding. But caring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not a man who... It wouldn't be good for you, if I was around all the time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. I know. She moves to him and they are kissing fierce.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop and the woman make love. She's the aggressor at first, pulling away Bishop's clothing, climbing on top of him, pulling her own clothes away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Bishop grabs the woman who LAUGHS in ecstacy. He reverses her, throwing her down on the bed, climbing on top. The two of them, eye to eye as they fuck...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Early morning light filters into the room. Bishop, awake, staring at the sleeping woman. His eyes click over to the clock which reaches 6:00 am. As if he's been waiting, Bishop rises and dresses, silently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop stands in front of the plate glass windows. He turns and moves to a music box on a shelf, opens it. A melancholy tune plays. He admires the machinery as he removes twenty $100 bills from his wallet, tucks them under the box...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay for breakfast? He turns. She's standing in the doorway, tying a robe around herself. A cool professionalism inhabits her demeanor. Not crass or mean-spirited, but the romance is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I ever?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. But there's a first time for everything. Bishop goes to the DVD player, slots out the DVD they watched the night before and pockets it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. This was a good one. See you next time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop... You all right? He turns, studies her. This is new ground. He nods and leaves. She stares a moment at the door after he's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop, running. Full-tilt again, a maintained sprint. He maneuvers through trees, over rocks. Below him, through the woods, his home comes into view... ... a BLACK BENTLEY sits parked in front of the house. A MAN on a cell phone stands by it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME - CONTINUOUS The man wears a mid-level suit, a hired professional.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into a phone) Yes, I just got here. No, not yet. He turns, REACTS as Bishop is there, CLOSE, barely sweating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (INTO PHONE) Hold on, I got him. The man holds his cell phone out for Bishop. A beat, Bishop studying the angles... he takes the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Arthur? Jesus Christ, Arthur, is that you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...How are you, Harry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Oh you know, I'm God Damn perfect. I'm redecorating my fucking office and I wanted your advice on the god forsaken curtains is how I am. (beat, serious) This is... this is something, Arthur. I need to see you, for old time's sake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop sits in the back, looks out at the city moving around them as the man drives. They approach the armored gates of a business tower: MCKENNA HOLDING CORP. The driver nods at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who recognize the car, open the gate. The car drops down into the garage under the building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop and the man exit the Bentley. Four more ARMED SECURITY down here, seated around a table, eating delivery from a local Deli. Two stand, one steps forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, gotta do this... Patient, Bishop puts his arms out as the man searches him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . - DAY Bishop steps out of the elevator into a top-level wonderland of money manipulation. Desks, crushed with monitors, manned by casually brilliant MIT-grads. Flat screens track the markets. All of this overseen by a witch's tit of a MANAGER who eyeballs Bishop coolly. A tapping gets Bishop's attention. The corner office is glass-walled. HARRY MCKENNA is tapping on it, gesturing Bishop inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The office is high-tech. Harry less so. 60's. Overweight and doesn't give a shit. Cigars in a ashtray, ash-burns on the Persian rugs. A man to be reckoned with, in his time. The time has perhaps passed. Harry comes out from behind his desk, points Bishop to a big leather sofa. Bishop perches on the arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like the new digs. McKenna LAUGHS, like a grunt. Fiddles with his hearing aid, turning it up. Bishop's eyes track.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Has it really been that long? Jesus. (BEAT) You know how they say youth is lost on the young? They're right. If I had my nineteen year old body back, I wouldn't be here, I'll tell you that. I'd be out there, making it my personal life mission to bang every stewardess who ever dared put on one of those whatchamacallit skirts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Times have changed, Harry. They don't wear skirts anymore. McKenna eyeballs Bishop, shakes his head. He goes to the glass wall, points out at the screens, financial markets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what all that is? (off Bishop's nod) That's their money, getting moved, exchanged. Made clean and neat and proper for Uncle Sam. And I have always been extremely careful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . McKenna goes to his desk, tosses legal papers on the table between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what that is? That's a God damn subpoena from the Justice Department. We get a new face in the white house, all of a sudden they want to look at my records. They got accountants want to go through MY BOOKS. Are you kidding me? I got the left hand coming after me for what I did for the right hand. Bishop looks over the papers, nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I call them up. I say "hey, you guys gotta get your own house in order..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And? And that's the point! Nothing. I tell them they have a problem here and instead of dealing with it I get silence, zippo, fuck- all. What are they, twelve?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I don't see how I can -- MCKENNA That's bullshit, Arthur. Your father -- they still talk about the guy like he walked on water. You, they'll listen to. You -- BISHOP I'm not a part of that. McKenna stares out the window at the street below, nervous. Shakes a pill out of as small vial, pops it. He chuckles, shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You remember that fishing trip we all took, back in the day. You were, what? About eight, right? (Off Bishop's nod) You fell out of the boat... couldn't swim a stroke. City kid. (Animated, laughing) You're in the water, splashing around. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got these big eyes like saucers, like you're sure you're gonna drown. Splashing... swallowing water... just STARING at your father and he's not making a move. Remember? Just looking down at you like... Suddenly it's gotten less funny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I finally had to grab you by the hair, pull you back into the boat. You're shivering like hell and he -- your dad -- gives one of those laughs. Those big laughs everyone loved him for. (BEAT) Anyway, the whole time you're in the water, you didn't cry out. Not once. You were a tough sonofabitch, even then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was a long time ago, Harry. McKenna turns from the window, takes in all his monitors, charts. Stock lines tick up and down, graphs flow, pulse...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm in the water this time, Arthur. You think it's easy for me to ask? It cuts like hell. But that's what I'm doing. Bishop eyes the barely open doorway into a small room off the office. Pillows and blankets on a sofa. Some clothes strewn about. McKenna's been sleeping here. A long beat. Bishop... nods. The tension seems to DRAIN from McKenna. He claps Bishop on the back, nods back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Thank you. Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Bishop's eyes track as elevator doors open and STEVE MCKENNA steps out, a beautiful young woman with him, LOUISE. She's a trophy, the woman you get for being top dog and the one you regret getting. Gorgeous, self-obsessed, entitled. She flops onto a leather sofa as Steve moves towards the office. Steve's young, mid-20's, strikingly handsome, wearing the casual uniform of wealth not earned. But there's something else that arrests Bishop immediately. Unwasted motion, detachment, observing the world around him... from above.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THROUGH THE GLASS WALL OF THE OFFICE

direction.raw_text: . Even as Steve nods to one of his father's security and pushes into the room, he picks up Bishop. The two men lock eyes, a strange reflection not of appearance, but of nature.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And here's the prodigal son, arrived to bilk me for ransom. (TO STEVE) Steve, this is Arthur Bishop. Steve shakes Bishop's hand. Strong. Observant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. Nice to meet you. You work for my father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, quite the opposite. Arthur's doing me a little favor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you're a criminal?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relax, relax. I'm kidding. A last beat between Steve and Bishop, then Steve lets it go, turns his attention to his father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need you to make a donation to Louise's charity. She's mounting some kind of fundraiser and she wants to make sure we do our part.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's it for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have no idea. And don't pretend you care, either. Write the check, go to the party, smile when the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: you and call you a great and generous man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ever think of having kids, Arthur?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Wearily, McKenna brings out his checkbook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wise man. How much?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thirty thousand. (Suddenly, to Bishop) You know, I can't tell what you're thinking, Mr. Bishop. Usually, I'm very good with that, with people. Sort of like a bullshit detector I developed. But you're very... hard to read.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be. So what are you thinking?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was thinking that a son, should be more grateful to his father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I agree. I agree. I often wonder why I'm not. McKenna tears the check out, hands it to Steve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There. Now go away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, dad. Are we going to see you at the house any time soon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, this is just a few more days. We got this... situation. Steve hears the dark in his father's tone, tracks it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything I can do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You? Yeah, you can earn some money. Get married. (BEAT) No, it's going to be okay now. Arthur's helping me out. Steve glances between the two men. Ego slightly bruised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well it's good to meet you Mr. Bishop. My father seems to trust you, which is... unusual. Bishop and McKenna watch as he hits the atrium, hands Louise the check who goes out of her mind, jumping up and down, giving him a kiss that speaks of more to come, trotting off. Steve glances back one more time, then follows her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We will take from our children for a lifetime what we would not suffer from another man for an instant. Explain that to me. (off Bishop's silence) Okay. Okay, call me when you hear something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You take care of yourself, Harry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that's your job now, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop exits the elevator. Security holds the door to the Bentley open for him. Bishop shakes his head, walks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop exits an old freight elevator, enters this HUGE loft space. Old architecture divided by free-standing walls hung with PAINTINGS from the same artist who's work hangs in Bishop's home. Intense, slightly surreal, deeply haunting. Nudes, raw. Men's faces, distraught, alone. A matronly ART DEALER comes forward familiar, takes his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur. Glad you're here. Right this way. As they move across the space Bishop catches sight of a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lying nude in a pool of blue paint. Across from her, The ARTIST is full-focused on her. He's roughly Bishop's age. Cigarette dangles off a lip, tattoos on his arms. Fully comfortable and committed to the alternative life. The model senses Bishop's gaze, looks over, unashamed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This way. Bishop follows the Dealer into another area where they approach a canvas. It's a portrait of a young boy, alone. The effect is of rage-filled isolation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zak is almost finished. It will make a wonderful addition to your collection. Bishop looks at the canvas. Nods. Glances back to where the artist is carefully adjusting his model's position.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you want to meet him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME - NIGHT Bishop enters his home, sets his things down. Stares at his phone a beat, then on impulse picks it up and dials. The voice that answers is female, official.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good evening, Mr. Bishop. How can I help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. I'd like to speak to Dean. There's a brief pause on the phone, then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Mr. Dean is not available right now. Can I take a message?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Just tell him I called. Bishop hangs up, stares at the phone. The doorbell rings. Bishop opens it to find a DHL COURIER on his doorstep. Bishop is suddenly casual, friendly. The public face of Bishop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Don. They make you drive all the way out here this evening?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The man gestures to the open barn door, the classic cars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You find tires for that old FleetMaster?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, not yet. Maybe when I do, we'll take it out for a spin. Say hello to the wife for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will do. Good night, Arthur. The man heads back towards his truck. Bishop tears away the strip that seals the envelope, a small USB jump-drive slides into his hands. The friendly grin on Bishop's face... evaporates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop fires up a computer hooked to a printer. He slots the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: drive into the computer. Nothing seems to happen, just a low pulsing red light on the drive. Almost instantly, his phone rings and he answers. Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should all be so lucky. Click. The phone goes dead. Almost at the same time, the glowing red light on the jump-drive turns GREEN. Bishop's PRINTER fires up. It starts printing out pages. A few medical charts... and then a photograph: Harry McKenna. The new mark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop eats. Lost in thought. Eyes play over his art...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop hits the study, work-mode. All hesitation gone. Pages are tacked up, other ripped down and tossed. He takes out a thick pen, circles words: "Syncope cardiac spasms..." "Prognosis..." "Poor eustachian tube function..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop sits at a desk under a reading lamp, making notes out of a stack of books. Medical textbooks. Charts. A diagram of the central nervous system. Stress tests. The technical specs for an electronic device.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop receives a SET OF PLANS from an attendant. Spreads them out over a counter. In the corner, a large photocopier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop sits at his desk, a Jeweler's Loup over one eye, working with soldering iron and electronic tools, meticulous. Behind him, tacked to the wall, are copies of the building plans. Heavily inked. Routes in and out penned in. Locations of security. Photographs. He's done his recon. Sitting in the sun on a window ledge: an open jar of Mayonnaise, turning rancid. A fly buzzes around it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Bishop is working on a hearing aide. Tweezers adjust a tiny chip, slot it into place... Phone rings. Bishop eyes it for a beat. Snaps it up. The voice on the other end is world weary, professional. DEAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Bishop. I heard you called. Hey, you get the stuff I sent you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what I called about. I know him. I think there might be a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Hold on a second. A long pause. Just air on the line. Bishop stares at his work in front of him, his research on McKenna tacked to the wall. Dean's voice comes back as suddenly as it departed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (CONT'D) No, it's been decided. This one's a go. You take care of yourself, Bishop. The line goes dead. Bishop stares at the phone for a second, sets it down. He looks up at Harry's picture on the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sun rises over the city, shafts of light illuminating the top floor plate glass of McKenna Holding Corp. The SOUND OF A PHONE RINGING, being picked up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They want to talk. I'm picking you up in an hour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Send your people home. I don't want anyone I don't know near you today. I'm serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Thank you, Arthur.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop hangs up his phone, watches as three bags of food are put up on the TO GO counter. "McKenna Garage" scrawled. Bishop approaches the counter, reaches over the bags for his own food, pushing his drink onto the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. My bad. The guy at the counter shrugs, turns for a mop. Bishop quickly reaches into the McKenna bag, switches a wrapped sandwich for one he brought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . - DAY A white van passes the entrance to the underground garage, pulls into the Alley behind the building and stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop kills the engine, pushes aside a curtain and heads into the back of the van which is empty aside for a heavy acetylene torch. The bottom of the van is covered by a thick black matt which Bishop kicks with his foot. The matt falls aside revealing a large HOLE in the bottom of the van, right down to the pavement and the welded steel cover Bishop has parked on top of.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Bishop picks up the torch, SPARKS IT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The four SECURITY are eating their delivered lunch. Security #1 puts a hand to his gut. Security #2 looks over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, call central. I'm not -- And with that, he's suddenly up and MOVING towards the bathroom. Security #2 raises his radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . - DAY Elevator doors open. Another SECURITY GUARD steps out, checks in by radio and heads down a corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: behind him, Bishop drops through the ceiling hatch, dressed casual. He hits a button, doors close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elevator doors open and Bishop steps out into the office. Deserted. Monitors glow, tracking markets and trades. But the human element is gone. Except for Harry, alone, silhouetted at one of his large plate windows, watching the sun rise over the city.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ever wonder what the last day of your life will feel like, Arthur?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You keep standing next to that window, maybe you'll be able to tell me. McKenna looks over, smiles weary. He looks exhausted. He goes to his desk, picks up a tie, looks to Bishop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This turns out alright, I'm going to send you a dozen Thai hookers and a case of Cuban Esplandidos. You can return the hookers if you want, but the cigars...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't smoke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will, my friend. For these, you will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop and McKenna heading down. McKenna watches the numbers. Bishop studies McKenna... then, casually:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why the change of security?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...What? Beat. Bishop SLAPS the STOP button. Elevator jerks to a halt. Bishop gets a finger into the doors, PRIES them open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur...? McKenna looks at the effort, sighs. Lets Bishop help him down. Halfway through, BALANCE SHIFTS, McKenna starts to fall. Bishop STEADIES him. McKenna STARES at Bishop, concerned. Bishop nods, heading towards the STAIRS, pocketing a small hearing aide as he goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: touching the hearing aide in his ear...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop and McKenna reach the bottom of the stairwell. McKenna's winded, steadying himself against a wall. Bishop cracks the door, peers out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell...? McKenna moves in, pushes Bishop aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : His SECURITY. Only there are two new faces in the garage. Replacements packing weaponry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't good, Arthur...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to me. Stay here. I'm going to check it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop, those men are armed...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry, relax. I know what I'm doing. And Bishop slips out the door, shutting it behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The moment he's out, he turns and sinks down in front of it, blocking it with his back. He opens his jacket, brings out a small TRANSMITTER. Waits a beat, then flicks a switch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McKenna there, STARING at the door. Nothing. He approaches the steel door, tries the handle. Can't open it. Nervous, he carefully puts his head against the door to listen...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! BLAM! BLAM! The SOUND OF GUNFIRE, VOICES fill McKenna's ears. He staggers back, crouched, terrified...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The sounds of gunfire is coming from it. BLAM! BLAM! More shots, then the sound of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harry! It's a trap! RUN!!! The door flies opens and Bishop LURCHES IN, gun raised. McKenna starts up the stairs, breathing hard. Behind him, he can see Bishop, gun lined back at the door. BLAM! BLAM! Gunshots assault his eardrums.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the other side of the door, Security hears the door slam, looks over for a moment, but there's nothing else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McKenna picks up the pace, hauling himself upwards. Sweat
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: off him, eyes wild. He stops, tries to catch his breath. Shooting PAIN through his right arm, he grabs it just as MORE GUNFIRE SOUNDS from below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Bishop comes rushing up the stairs. His shirt stained with blood. Gun in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on! If we can get to the roof I can hold them off! Come on! McKenna GULPS AIR, staggers on...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Door BLOWS open, McKenna staggers onto the rooftop. The manic victory of having made it clashing with the tragic knowledge that his heart is rebelling. He falls to his knees, clutching his right arm. PAIN coursing through his body. Unaware for the moment that everything has gone silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: come into his view. He looks up, sees Bishop standing over him. Bishop's face is a death mask. Emotion removed. Harry stares into his eyes... and understands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...You. Bishop nods. McKenna CACKLES which turns into a scream as
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sends him reeling. He falls, hitting his head. Blood rolls down his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bastard. You... Sonofabitch. You didn't have the balls... The balls to AARRRGHHHH! He CONVULSES. Tears stream down his face. His body HEAVING, not giving up the ghost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We know it's in there. But it doesn't show. Instead he checks his watch, calculates time...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God. Oh, Jesus Christ help me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!! ARRRRGHHHHHH!!!! Please... Please... Please... McKenna stops struggling, stares up at Bishop. Tears streaming down his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, Arthur, put me out of my misery. Your father... Bishop checks his watch again, doesn't meet McKenna's eyes. Checks the stair door, looks over the building edge...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please. I'm scared. I'm really god damn scared... Suddenly Bishop MOVES. Lightening fast, wrapping up McKenna's head, fingers PRESSING expertly along arteries. McKenna STARES UP one horrible second, then goes limp in his arms, dead. Bishop releases, stands, stares down. For the first time, uncertainty in his face. Why did he do that? He looks at the body, at his hands, out at the city. Wipes his forehead with the back of a hand, furious at himself. He reaches down, removes the hearing aide from McKenna's ear, replaces it with the original, turns away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . McKenna's body, alone on the rooftop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as he pushes through doors into a MASS of Police, detectives, private security, lawyers, all milling about on phones, gathered around a figure on the ground...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Art Dealer hands Bishop the finished painting, wrapped. At the far end of the studio the Artist and his friends smoke and drink and laugh. Bishop nods thanks, turns and leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve stares down at his dead father. A COP draws a line around the body. Steve is expressionless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME - NIGHT Bishop backs off from the wall where he has just hung the new painting of the boy. It stares back at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blue-gray morning. Cold wind blows across the rooftop. Steve watches the last police leave. He's alone. He stares down at the outline where his father lay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A funeral in progress, hundreds of flower arrangements, decorations, fit for a head of state. A few dozen attendees. At the front, Steve McKenna sits in front of his father's coffin, cold. His girlfriend Louise next to him, weeping. She cries at funerals. Bishop stands at the back. His eyes scan over the proceedings. Sixth-sense, Steve suddenly turns his head, makes eye contact with Bishop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His good works comfort all of us, even in his going. We commit his remains to your earth, oh Father, and we pray you vouchsafe him eternal life and that you bring comfort to those who have been left behind. His only son, Steve, who is himself devoted to -- The Priest falters as Steve rises, moves away from the event. Bishop tracks him as he wanders through gravestones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Glory be to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Ghost...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the gravesite, men fill in the hole with dirt. Nearby, six limousines are lined up. But only the one directly after the hearse has its door open for Louise who stands, waiting, looking for Steve. Bishop watches the dirt hit the coffin. Then looks over as Steve approaches through mausoleums.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My condolences.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, Harry was a popular guy. Good to see so many of his friends here. Touching. Bishop considers, tracks the attendees who pass by a suited man as they leave... Each of them receiving and pocketing an envelope as they do. Bishop looks back to Steve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Best grief money can buy. Give me a ride home?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Bishop nods to the head limo where Louise is waving impatiently at Steve to come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like you have one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, all of that. Empty limos. Fake guests. All so that the papers print what an important and respected man Harry was. Steve takes in the one or two guests, already counting their money a few yards away. Shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I hope it's what Harry would have wanted. But it's not for me. Beat. Bishop nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop steers the car into the hills, past high-end estates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, what I don't get is you. Harry didn't have any friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your dad worked with my father a long time ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, just paying my respects.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So your old man was into all that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, he was into all that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that is refreshingly honest, Mr. Bishop. What about you? Bishop doesn't answer, steers the car up a manicured drive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : An ESTATE. A main house, lawns, pools, guest houses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve and Bishop get out of the car. The McKenna estate was modeled neoclassical for a wanna-be emperor. Now a week of youth with limitless credit has left its mark. A SOUND SYSTEM has been set up poolside. A DJ spins a trance-like deep groove. YOUNG WOMEN lounge around the pool in bikinis, less. Beautiful and bored. YOUNG MEN, most dressed modern hip-hop, mostly white, eyeball the women, fist-bump each other, drink beers. Steve takes the whole thing in, nods, somehow pleased.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why is it so comforting, when people surpass even our lowest expectations? (BEAT) Come on in, meet the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, thanks. I've got to -- STEVE Please. A favor to me. None of these people even remembered what today was. Bishop nods. They move into the scene. People recognize Steve, hug or bump-fists. Steve's friendly, but stays locked on Bishop. Bishop observes it all, not uncomfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you believe in fate, Mr. Bishop?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? A basketball hoop has been set up near the pool. Young men take turns dunking and then landing in the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think maybe we're all doomed to become our fathers. I'll probably die spoiled, corrupt, lonely and alone. Runs in the blood. What would that make you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're still young. You can do pretty much whatever you please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: two girls kiss each other, filmed in DV by an young entrepreneur.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think so? Just chuck all this and go help the children in South America, something like that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well look at you, Mr. Bishop. You're a dreamer. Steve heads inside. A beat, Bishop follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As soon as they enter, Steve finds himself locked up by two
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who whisper excitedly in his ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well? Do you want to...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, in fact I'm pretty sure that's illegal in this state. (TO BISHOP) Come on, this way. Steve leaves the Beauties disappointed, moves up some stairs. Bishop follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve and Bishop move into another room where two HUGE flatscreens have converted the room into a Wii court. Young muscle-bound posers play a first person head-to-head shoot-em game. Others drink, CHEER. Two bump fists with Steve. One fronts cool at Bishop, fakes a punch at him. Bishop just watches, doesn't do a thing. The kid smiles, nods... On the floor, paintings of Harry McKenna, discarded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This used to be Harry's realm. Now Steve's taken it over. Giant ornate king bed. Huge balcony overlooking the estate. Steve goes to the railing of the balcony, looks down at the grounds, the people. Bishop hangs back, glances into a private study, untouched from when Harry ruled there. Papers, books, a portrait of Harry over the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, I went up there. To where my father died.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell of a place to die. Lonely... Bishop comes abreast of Steve, also looks down. Removed from the party and the pool area, a separate area of the estate contains an outdoor gym. Weights, exercise equipment, a fighting matt and martial arts equipment all present.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (off the gym area) That all yours?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If the body is weak, the mind can't be strong. Bishop nods, impressed. Something about this young man. Engaged, observing Bishop, but not needy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Steve! Steve, man. It's Louise. At the door, a FRIEND of Steve's is held back by security.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's up in the bungalow. I think she might really do it this time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My girlfriend thinks that my father's death is a good time to kill herself. She thinks I'm not showing the appropriate human reaction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll let myself out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, please. You've seen this much. Aren't you interested? I am. Off Bishop...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve and Bishop push through a guarded gate, up a small path arriving at a beautiful bungalow, set back in the gardens. Candle light glows inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louise is nude, immersed in the water of a jacuzzi located in the center of the room. On the side, she has a bottle of scotch, some pills, and two razor blades. She looks up at Steve, streaked eyes dart to Bishop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A friend. Would have thought you'd have started by now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't about me. It's about you. You need to watch. Steve crouches down, pours himself a shot from her whiskey bottle. Something angry and cold in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. I'm here. I'm watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't believe I'll do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I know you, Louise. You'll do just about anything if it'll get you enough attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think you can hide behind that cool attitude. Like nothing matters to you. But I know you. You care. You feel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I? Louise blinks, scared a little. But she pushes the fear away, picks up one of the razor blades. A beat, then with a quick gesture, she slices across one wrist. Blood rises to the surface, runs down her arms into the water. Steve doesn't move. Neither does Bishop. Louise picks up the second blade with the cut hand. Fingers fumble, but she gets it. Slices across her other wrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Blood runs... stains the water rose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Wow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long will it take?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Bishop? Bishop rises, looks down at her in the tub.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much do you weigh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hundred and ten. His eyes take in her body, the flow from her wrists...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a hundred and twenty-five. It'll take an hour and a half, maybe two. When you get cold... then you'll know you're close. Steve takes in Bishop in this moment, nods. Glances at the clock: 9:30. Then he refills his drink, heads out to the patio outside. Sits facing away from them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll stop it. He thinks he's above it all. But he's not. No one is. Bishop nods. Not clear if he's agreeing or observing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop sits with Steve on the patio. From inside, Louise's soft crying can be heard. Seen through the trees in front of them, young people dance, splash, party.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve! Steve! I know you feel this. I know you'll stop me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you don't care anything about your life, why should I? Steve looks to Bishop. He checks his watch. 10:30.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm getting cold. Please. I'm frightened. I'm scared, Steve. Bishop looks at Steve who just keeps staring outwards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can help her if you want. The sounds of water, splashing. Louise arrives on the patio, a blood-stained robe loosely pulled on around her. Mascara eyes ran. She stares down at Steve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a bastard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what the kick of it is, Louise? If you actually had the stones, then there's be something for us. But in 30 seconds when you run down that path and all of those people go crazy saving your life... Well, then we'll be done. (BEAT) I know. Catch-22. Life's not fair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe nothing. Maybe you never really knew me. A beat. Louise, looking between the two men. She SWAYS on her feet and Bishop puts a hand out, steadies her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a bastard, too. Both of you. Like looking in some dark mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on, Louise. You'll do fine. The world's gonna love you. Louise steps away, turns, stumbling down the path into the dark. A beat, the men just watching after her and then a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: from below. COMMOTION, ACTION. People rush to Louise, help her to the ground. Others pulling out cell phones, call for help. Louise's LOUD cries drift back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you have let her do it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll never know, will we? Steve rises, heads up a small path.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve and Bishop, walking high above the estate. Far below them, the lights of an ambulance in the driveway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't answer my question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody dies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. But it's a whole other world when you're personally involved. There's a very big tab that has to be picked up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Such as? Bishop stops, looks down at the action far below them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Governments, cops, the military... we give young men a licence and send them into it blind, thinking it'll all be okay. Because someone told them they had permission. (BEAT) But when you cross over that line, you do it alone. Most people, they stay that way from then on. Alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody can kill. You take a mother, protecting her child...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. But that's instinct. What I'm talking about is up here... (tapping his head) Knowledge of foresight. Intention. A person who knows that the only way to truly be free of man's laws, is to break his highest one. Beat. It sits there, between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you telling me all this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did you want me to see that little stunt with your girlfriend? Bishop stares down the hill at the commotion. Ants swarming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These aren't your people, are they? You don't have "people." Your life is crowded, but you're alone. Steve unconsciously nods, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, you're right. You grow up spoiled, rich, like me... Only thing you really learn to recognize in people is when someone wants something from you. (BEAT) What do you want, Mr. Bishop? What are you doing here? Bishop considers Steve, thrown. Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks for the tour. It's been interesting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, it has. Bishop turns, heads back down towards the estate. Steve watches him go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME - NIGHT Bishop stares down at the line of supplements and pills set out in front of him, something gnawing at him. His cat nuzzles around his legs, purring. He scoops up the lot, washes them down with water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop sits on his sofa, antsy. On the TV, the day's news plays out in silence. Anti-American PROTESTS in a Middle- Eastern country. Words scroll: "...Official resistance to US eavesdropping policy..." "...Break down of high-level..." Bishop rises, goes to a stack of DVD's. Grabs one, slots it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The WOMAN, speaking to him from her beautiful apartment. Similar to the one we saw. She leans against a large plate glass windows, shirt and panties, sipping wine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you. Jesus, what a night. We went to opening of Fernando's new restaurant and Betty was there wearing -- well, whatever we call those things she wears...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DVDs. There must be twenty of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I miss you. Everybody says hi, of course. But with me... it's like I feel you there with me, even when you're not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : She pulls her shirt off over her head, faces the camera again, topless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I feel the way you touch me... Bishop rises, blows out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Dropping in on Bishop, SPRINTING on the treadmill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: than we've seen him go before. ON and ON. He hits the weights, slots extra 45's onto the press bar. The weights CLANG into place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the enormous weight. One, two, three... He RACKS the weights, disgusted. Gets up, throws on more weight. He PRESSES it again. Five... six... RACKS it again, angry. Adds MORE WEIGHT. Back under the bar. Pressing. Muscles distending, STRAINING. Seven... Eight... He CRIES OUT as something GIVES in his shoulder. The Weight
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: down on him, crushing him. A moment in his eyes, the weight pressing the air out of his lunges. He LAUGHS MANIC, SURGES up against the weight, tossing it off, the weights slamming into the floor, BOOM!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop's car pulls up fast. He gets out, tosses the valet his keys, heads in, weirdly focused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop sits alone at a reserved table at the back, a plate of sashimi in front of him. He looks out at the restaurant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Laughter, smiles, hands touching, hands waving mid-story, lips parting. Woman's hands touching their necks, eyes sparkling, men laughing, wallets flashing... Bishop rises suddenly, his hand going to his wallet, trying to get out of there. ROOM SWAYS. He steadies himself, moves towards the exit. People look over, alarmed as he grabs backs of chairs to steady himself. VERTIGO LOOMING, sounds
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and suddenly he's FALLING into blackness...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop, shirtless. A FEMALE DOCTOR is examining the injury. Professional, but attractive. And attracted to him. Her hands on his shoulder, gentle. Her other hand on his back. Her eyes play over his form: SCARS, WOUNDS, healed. A battlefield for a body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quite a collection you have here. Military?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does this hurt? Bishop smiles, recognizing the nature of the touch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, a little. The doctor lets her hands rest just a fraction too long, then moves across the room, writes in a chart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any next of kin, anybody we can notify? (off his shake no) How about an acquaintance?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Am I going to die?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, not today. Bishop reaches for his shirt, slips it on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You damaged your deltoid muscle. But that doesn't explain the anxiety attack. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any unusual stress recently? Something at work? (off his shake no) I'm prescribing Cataflam for the pain and Paxil for the stress and I'm going to give you my card. If you have any other episodes... or if you need anything else, don't hesitate to give me a call. She holds out her card. He looks at her, lets her stay that way for a moment, then takes the card. She looks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can pay at the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop pays cash. He crumples the prescriptions, tosses it in the trash, starts to toss the doctor's card. Beat. He can see her down the hall, speaking with another doctor. Pretty, real. A moment, he pockets the card.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . - DAY Steve sits in his father's office chair, staring back at us, occasionally nodding. We REVERSE to find a collection of Investigators, a Forensic Doc, and a hardened SECURITY SPECIALIST. The Doc is in the middle of a presentation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hold diagrams, conclusions, crime scene photos, all about Harry McKenna. The Doc demonstrates the precise hold, the pressure points that killed Harry McKenna. Steve watches, impassive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop runs through the woods, full-tilt. Finally stops in front of his house. He feels his injured shoulder, winces...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME - EVENING Bishop sits on his sofa in front of the TV: A bureaucrat at a press conference. A female diplomat pushes through photogs with her hand up, shielding her face. Words scroll: "US Intelligence under scrutiny... High level meeting..." Bishop hits the remote and the TV goes to static, white noise again. His eyes... relax, almost asleep. We stay on his face, a glimpse into his only moments of peace...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! BANG! BANG! POUNDING on his front door. Bishop's eyes POP open. He's on his feet, instantly alert, moving past a sideboard. He touches a hidden catch, a "click" and he reaches underneath, comes out with a handgun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FRONT DOOR, BISHOP'S HOME - MOMENTS LATER Steve is there, pounding on the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Bishop! Arthur! Please, I need to speak with you. The front door opens. Bishop, fronting sleepy. Steve is
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: eyes blazing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What time is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanna show you something. Please. It'll be... It'll be interesting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve drives, too fast. Bishop is shotgun. The rear area usually reserved for passengers is empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gonna tell me what the big surprise is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd rather show you. I know, melodramatic. But I think it'll be worth it to you. Bishop TENSES, almost imperceptible as Steve pilots the car into the underground structure beneath McKenna Holding Corp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Car screeches to a stop. Steve grabs a case, is out. Bishops takes in the area. Two of Steve's SECURITY there, looking stern. Bishop checks the gun he has concealed in his waistband, reaches for his door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elevator opens at the very top. Steve pushes out onto the roof. Bishop follows. Security lighting floods on, illuminating the desolate surface in eerie even light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Steve opens his case, starts tossing down PHOTOGRAPHS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Harry McKenna. Dead on the roof. Other details. The doors, the elevator shaft, everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: coroner's documents. Medical photographs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe it's time you start talking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (off the papers) You know what that says? My dad didn't die of a heart attack. I mean, he was dying of a heart attack, but that's not what killed him. The blood flow to his brain was cut off, his brain died before his body. Somebody killed him. On Bishop, considering Steve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do the police think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The police? They don't want to hear about this. I mean, they'll look into it. But they don't very much like the idea that they totally missed this one and it'd be just easier for everyone if I would shut the hell up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...What do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They killed him. Here, on the roof of his own building. His own security all around. Why here? Why even kill him, if he was already dying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You tell me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To make a point. That no one's safe. That they can get to anyone, whenever they want to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what am I doing here? Bishop, supremely alert, listening. Tracking shadows...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got my black belt in Karate when I was nineteen. I've studied Judo since I was six.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm impressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you're not. Most people are, but you're not. If I came at you right now, I'd wind up dead as my father, wouldn't I? Bishop doesn't answer. Steve breaks away, looks down at the place where his father died.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Same as if I tried to exact justice for my father. These men, what this is... It's something you know about, isn't it? (BEAT) Something you could teach me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't get the impression you even liked Harry very much. Steve SURGES forward. Real anger, intensity boiling over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really going to stand there and judge how much I loved my father? What the hell do you know about it? Bishop, hearing this. A nerve touched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Besides, this isn't just about Harry. Harry's dead, may he rest in peace. But this is about me. They came here and they killed my father. They did that to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want revenge. Steve doesn't answer. A long moment between them. Steve turns, looks out over the city.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know the word "Nemesis"? It's not actually a word. It's a name. She was one of the Greek goddesses. Of anger. Retribution against any mortal who became too proud. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The executor of divine justice. It's a beautiful idea, don't you think? Justice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Justice? A beat. Bishop shakes his head, turns, starts to walk back towards the elevators. Steve collects his papers, angry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine. Fine. In case you haven't noticed, I now have a couple of million dollars to spend on this, so I will find them myself and I'll deal with them myself and if I wind up dead trying, you can bury me right next to dear old dad -- BISHOP Jesus, stop your whining.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! No one's ever spoken to Steve that way. He STARES. A stillness between them, even the wind slows, waiting...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Corner of sixth and Grand. Tomorrow morning. 7:00 am. Don't be late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't. Beat. Bishop nods, starts to leave, turns back...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And Steve... no more surprises like this, okay? Steve nods. Bishop goes. On Steve, watching as the elevator doors erase the older man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME - NIGHT Bishop stands in the middle of his home, still. Thinking. Then he moves to his office, grabs a newspaper. He moves to his Study, turns to a page, slaps it down on the glass on his scanner. Hits a button, the white light of the scanner passes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Big King bed, never used. A huge painting by the Artist on the wall across from the bed. Landscape. Empty. Ruined. Bishop hoists the painting down off the wall. He has a print- out from his computer, tacks it in the center of the blank space left by the painting: The picture of Steve, scanned from the McKenna Obituary, enlarged. Tacked alone on the wall. A start.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop stands on the corner, waiting. He checks his watch:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: :58. Steve's Bentley pulls up to the corner, parks in a handicapped space. Steve gets out, nods to Bishop. Bishop takes in Steve, the Bentley, a metermaid ten yards away, already moving towards them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop enters this linoleum-lined hallway, slips the bored
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: $100. The man hits a button, a door CLICKS open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they enter, fluorescent lights flicker on. Cheap, overused. Some burnt out, others shorting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: line the room. Bodies, covered in green morgue drapes. Steve's eyes play over it. He swallows. Bishop is cold, business-like.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay focused. This is a test. Bishop moves down the rows, pulling drapes away as he does. Nude BODIES are revealed. Men, women, teens. In some, the reason for their death is obvious. Others aren't telling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to know about killing, look around. Steve does, a little creeped out, but keeping it cool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The act of killing, is an end in itself. Any other motive keeps it from being pure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The psychopath has no motive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, he's driven, compelled, by his sickness. He's as much the victim as those he kills. More drapes fall. Dead eyes stare up at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But when you make your own law, you're responsible to no one else but yourself. Maybe you're free...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you? This isn't some idea anymore. This is the real thing. You still with me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am. Another drape falls. A beautiful woman. No signs of injury.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ever heard the term "Mechanic" used outside of its normal meaning?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My father used it. A dealer... a guy who works the tables. Bishops smiles, shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or a... killer. A hit man. Bishop just stares. Steve shakes his head, looks away from Bishop, winds up staring at a dead man. Laughs to himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you thinking?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had you pegged as... a security consultant. Maybe ex-military. Someone who... protects people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe I do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or maybe you just get paid to kill people. Bishop nods his head yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So why let me in? I mean, I know what I want. What do you get out of it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Times are changing. Security is better trained, more lethal. Sometimes I could use a partner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit. Bishop nods, smiles. He moves away from the tables, leaves Steve standing in the middle of it all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In this... there isn't room for those who are outside of it. There's too much isolation. Friendships can't work. Eventually everyone expects you to account. The isolation... becomes a liability. You stand out. Standing out... isn't good. Steve smiles, shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need a... friend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An associate. (BEAT) I'm offering to teach you something that most people can't be taught.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because you think I'm a natural.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That remains to be seen. (taps his head) But you're alone in there, aren't you? That's... the prerequisite. Steve continues to stare at the bodies. Bishops starts towards the exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think it over.
direction.name: direction
