direction.raw_text: Bishop... (BEAT) When I find the men who murdered my father. You help me to kill them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You may never find them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't answer my question. A beat. Bishop nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dropping into the middle of a FIGHT. Steve and Bishop, attacking each other, mixed martial arts. Steve is the aggressor, moves in knocking Bishop's defenses away. HITTING Bishop who takes the punch, steps back... Steve's still on him. Kicking, two, three times. Bishop catches a kick, tosses Steve back. He lands cat-like on his feet, comes back at Bishop, strong. Hitting, pushing Bishop back against a wall, seeming to dominate the fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! A buzzer goes off. Bishop drops his guard, would be flattened if Steve didn't pull his punch, walks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Behind Bishop's gym is a rifle range. An assortment of weapons lie on a table. In front of them, some trees, some old cars... some bottles sitting on the limbs of the trees. Bishop picks up a handgun, checks his pulse. Steve has obviously learned from him, does the same. Bishop raises the gun. BLAM! BLAM! Two bottles shatter at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: yards. He tosses Steve the gun. Steve keeps two fingers on his pulse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm still at 130.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. I'm working on it. Bishop nods, picks up the rifle, sights. BLAM! 1,000 yards away, the bullet IMPACTS the head-rest of an abandoned car. Bishop looks to Steve who gives up, raises the handgun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! BLAM! BLAM! Three shots. Three misses. Steve tosses down the gun, frustrated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were still over 100.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What am I supposed to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are no perfect situations. You fought me at 100%, so you were winning. But in doing so, you gave up your shooting option. (BEAT) It's all about choices. Always. Bishop starts to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop... What's your 100% look like? Bishop smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two cars BLISTERING down the highway. Bishop's Cobra and Steve in a classic Maserati. They JOCKEY for position, WEAVE in and out of the other cars on the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Portrait of control. Expertly working the tuned car, coaxing power and speed out of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Careless, going for broke, not caring if he has the space to make his moves. He SWERVES his car, right at Bishop... ... who has to PEEL away, off the highway, onto the smooth dirt-pack. He DOWNSHIFTS, blasts back onto the road, catching air. Steve LAUGHS out load as they CREST the top of a rise...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : An existing accident. A beer truck jack- knifed across the freeway. Bishop BRAKES, fighting for control. Steve SWERVES his car, too fast, it goes into a SPIN... CLIPS another car, gains air and PLOWS ass-backwards into the side of the beer truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: slides to a stop. Bishop gets out, tracks:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: climbing out of the Maserati onto the hood protruding from the side of the truck. LAUGHING, WHOOOPING at the sky. Bishop approaches, sees that hundreds of bottles of BEER have cascaded out of the punctured truck. Steve wipes blood from a cut on his forehead, grabs a beer and cracks it, swigs as he sits on the Maserati hood. He grabs another, tosses it to Bishop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on up, man. The view is beautiful. Bishop takes in the situation, the small crowd gathering... he jumps up, sits on the hood of the car with Steve, both leaning back against the cracked windshield.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You lost control.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think? Steve puts out his beer. A hesitation, then Bishop clinks beers with him. They both drink. Stretched out in front of them, the highway seems to go on forever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ever think about just... going? Leaving. Never turning back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Sometimes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have... responsibilities. I have a cat. A beat. Steve LAUGHS loud. Bishop laughs. Maybe the first time in ages. They drink, watch the sun move lower in the sky as emergency vehicles approach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME - EVENING Steve comes in from the guest-house, showered. Sees Bishop at the dining room table, takes in the place for the first time. The art on the walls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, looking at these, a person might think maybe there's a screw or two loose up there... Steve catches sight of a manila envelope in front of his empty place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this what I think it is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be so eager. Open it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: diagrams. Pictures. They're of an outdoor area. Steve's eyes scan over them, interested.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's the Mark?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A huge square filled with VENDORS selling all manner of food and good out of CARTS and STALLS. Music, voices, crowds of people. Bishop moves through. Dressed average, just a guy in the crowd. He watches a couple argue. Moves on...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) It's not good enough to simply follow your Mark and attack him. Most of these people know they're targets. They'll be watching for you. ... A moment, then Steve enters the frame, tracking Bishop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) You need to understand the location, control the situation. You're looking for escapes, security, police presence... Bishop passes two COPS, squeezes between two parked produce trucks towards the row of shops that border the square.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop stands in front of a case, watches the precision instruments tick. From behind a counter, the Chinese OWNER notices him, puts down the watch he's repairing, approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: s, authoritative, a LOUP on his forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Interest you in anything? Bishop takes in the man, eyes check polished reflective surfaces, back to the man. Bishop points to a watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a beauty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know your instruments...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Concealed amidst exotic Guatemalan wraps, Steve tracks the Watch Shop. The attractive older woman running the stall eyes him. He looks right through her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Bishop exits, heading back into the market.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Most of all, you need to answer this question: "How does this man die here today?" Bishop passes a butcher cutting into a slab of meat. Steve follows behind Bishop, lost in the sea of people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) Everybody, everyday, has a way to die. You have to find it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop stands in front of stall filled with classic toys, rocking horses, vintage dolls. His gaze finds a large, still- boxed doll of the "Luna Cromwell" character that the Grocery Owner's Daughter is obsessed with. Almost life-sized.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They don't make that anymore. That's a classic. I can let you have it for three hundred...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop turns away from the stand carrying the doll. A GROUP of teens RUNS by Bishop, buffeting him for a moment. Slightly off kilter, he checks his surroundings. Nothing. Bishop starts again, aware for the first time that a MAN is headed his direction, passing a knife-sharpening stand, blades gleaming, his face hidden by a low hat... Bishop tracks the figure out of the corner of his eye, turns and pushes through the tight space between two stalls, out the back where trucks are parked. Bishops glances back for the man, squeezes between two large trucks... ...coming out the other side when POP! A loud SOUND makes Bishop glance over. A HISSING coming from one of the trucks which starts to ROLL backwards and Suddenly HANDS are on Bishop from behind, PUSHING HIM backwards, into the space between the two trucks! A FLASH, A SPLIT SECOND to stare into Steve's face, holding him there to be crushed and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The one truck SLAMS into the second, the vice closed, metal crumpling. Bishop, at the last minute pulled back by Steve who's holding him there, smiling. A beat. Bishop checks the surroundings, nods. Steve release him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Good. Very good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good? That's all you got? How about God damn perfect, man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't get cocky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Broad daylight. A thousand witnesses. Man takes a wrong step. Excuse me if I take a moment to appreciate myself. Because that was poetry. (laughing, smiling) You just can't bring yourself to be impressed, can you? Bishops considers, notices that the Luna Cromwell doll has fallen in the gutter. Picks it up, tries to dry it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hand to his ear) What's that? You're what? Oh, you are impressed? No, come on, you don't have to say that. Really, I'm fine with -- You what? You've never seen someone better? Wow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. You did very well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn straight I did. And now, in celebration of me, I'm taking you to a restaurant where the waitresses... what? Something about Bishop's serious gaze has stopped Steve. Bishop reaches into his jacket, places a gun in Steve's hands. A confused beat, Steve conceals the weapon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Bishop?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a man behind me. Look up once, then look away. Don't look back. Steve glances up. We realize we're right in front of the watch store. The OWNER is pulling the steel grate down over his store, closing for the day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Look...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did good here. Really good. But this was just a game. That man... is your graduation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He owns the watch store.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. I meant... what did he do? Bishop comes close, FOCUSED.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've taught you how to kill without anyone knowing there was a murder. I've taught you to be invisible. But that's strategy, not killing. The real test... it's the actual killing, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you want this? Be very sure. Because you can walk away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I'm ready. Bishop studies him... nods. Turns to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop... We're right here, where you wanted us to wind up. You knew where I'd hit you, didn't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...School's out. Bishop leaves. Steve watches him go. Stuck. Helpless. He turns back. The Owner is headed home for the day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop sits back at his reserved table in the rear of the place. In a chair next to him, the doll is awkwardly perched. Around him, people LAUGH. Lovers NUZZLE.. He reaches into his breast pocket, slides out a new DHL envelope, tears it open. A new jump-drive slides onto the table. He eats, takes pills, his eyes locked on the drive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Luna doll) Who do you think that is, Luna? He takes a card out of his wallet, studies it. It's from the flirtatious doctor. He pulls out his phone, dials.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve sits in a nondescript car, lights out, parked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Two stories up, a lit apartment. The WATCH STORE OWNER crosses by one of the lit windows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Owner has a delicate vintage Brietlang in his hands. He places it on a patch of velvet, watch-repair tools laid next to it. He moves to an old stereo, puts the needle of a turn- table down on spinning vinyl. The lonely sounds of Brahms Piano Concerto No. 2 fill the room. He returns to his desk, sits. A tiny noise from the hall. A "click." He looks up, sees nothing, settles in to work...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To the front HALLWAY. Steve stands in the hallway, motionless. He's just closed the front door behind him. In his hands, a lock-pick set which he now pockets and pulls out the gun Bishop gave him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No way to tell where he is. He's holding the Luna doll. He reaches forward, knocks on a door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's open!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The WOMAN's apartment. Not the doctor's, the same we've been to before. Everything eerily identical to the last time. Sofas, gas fire, throws and rugs, open bottle of wine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll just be a minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of the woman in her bedroom, topless in front of a vanity. She glances back, smiles warm. Laughs a little when she sees the doll.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's for a friend. Bishop awkwardly sets the doll down near the front door, moves on, into the apartment. Restless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry I was away so long this time. I had some complications -- WOMAN'S VOICE Don't be. He turns. She's emerged from the bedroom, adjusting the dress she's just pulled on. Beautiful. She comes up to him, kisses him. He doesn't respond. She backs off, moves to the kitchen to pour two wines,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know who I saw yesterday? (BEAT) Bradley Fliescher. He and Ginny have this little cottage up the coast they hardly use. I was thinking, maybe next week you and I should go. Approaching, handing him a wine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and me, the whole weekend. What would we... do? She approaches him, sexy. Touches him, intimate. He stares at her, blank. She recovers fast, moves off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course why do we need that? We have each other right here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carefully, slowly, Steve makes his way down the hall towards the lit living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The owner pauses, enjoying the crescendo of the music. Eyes closed for a moment. Then they open... ... Steve is standing in the doorway to the living room, the gun pointed at the owner. The owner sees him, becomes motionless. The two men staring across the space between them... and then everything happens very fast. The Owner LURCHES to the side with surprising speed and agility just as Steve FIRES! The bullet catches the Owner in the side, SPINNING him around. He CRASHES to the floor... ... but only for an INSTANT. THEN he's BACK ON HIS FEET, MOVING across the room! Steve tracks, pulls the trigger again but the gun only "clicks" empty. The man reaches a coat rack, grabs it in one fluid motion and is MOVING back at Steve who barely has time to drop the gun and BLOCK the rack as it SLICES through the air at him. The Owner HITS and HITS again. Skilled, professional, martial-arts trained. Steve blocking one, two, the third hit connects, sends Steve REELING back, crashing through the watch-repair table. The Owner leaps at him with the rack. Steve is BARELY able to catch the end before it impales him. The two men,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the Owner FORCING the point lower towards Steve's face... ... Blood pools on Steve's shirt. Steve and the Owner both track it. The man is bleeding badly from the bullet wound. A split-second calculation and the man abandons the coat- rack, races across the room as Steve clambers to his feet. The man reaches the far wall, hits a RELEASE. The wood paneling slides open, revealing a CAR-15 fully automatic assault rifle with a silencer. The man grabs it, opens up! Bullets CHEW through furniture, drywall, glass searching for Steve who DIVES into the hallway, retreating as the man comes forward, firing in deadly precise BURSTS. Steve hides behind a wall which ERUPTS, blown to bits. He stumbles through a doorway into a KITCHEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stillness. The woman and Bishop, staring forward, watching another of her videos. Another late-night diary. She's in a long shirt and panties, leaning close to the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know what I dreamed? I dreamed you and I had a child... Bishops turns from the screen, walks away. Beat, she silences the TV, moves to join him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, it's crazy. I don't want to pin you down. I know you need your freedom. I just... sometimes I miss you so much... He's staring at her, oddly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? A beat. His eyes move down to her sofa where another man's tie has been discarded. A moment, then she shakes her head, angry with herself. The pretense dropping. The real woman scooping up the tie, tossing in a drawer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. Really, I am. I just... You didn't give me any warning this time. (BEAT) I'm sorry, Bishop. It won't happen again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay. Really. It's okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Holding the CAR-15. Listening for his target. His hand moves to the wound in his side, comes away covered in blood. Another decision, the man slides the weapon over his shoulder, retreats... ...MOVING with the man, through his apartment. He reaches his BATHROOM, blows inside. Tosses the toilet tank to the side, reaches in and comes out with a military-grade STIM needle which he JAMS into his own thigh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: with the Owner, feeling the drug course through his system, giving him strength...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Steve comes out of nowhere, HITS the man in the head with a heavy copper pot, sending him reeling back into the tub. Steve starts forward, DIVES to the side as the man opens back up, full auto, bullets CHEWING everything... CAR-15 finally clicks empty. Steve rises... and the Man is on him, kicking him. Steve, rolling away. The man PULLING him back. WHAM! WHAM! Steve takes brutal punches to the head and face. Blocks one and they GRAPPLE, rolling in the tight space of the hallway, the man coming up on top, pinning Steve's arm, SLAMMING him in the ribs. Something SNAPS. Steve SCREAMS, surges up with the man... smashing him THROUGH a small table, winding up on top of him, his hand around the owners throat... The two men... eye to eye. Fierce, deadly. Steve SQUEEZING the life out of him. The man's free arm HITTING Steve, OVER and OVER. Brutal body blows. Steve takes the punishment... continues to Squeeze... ...Finally, the man weakening. In his face... a dull resignation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who... are... you? Steve doesn't answer, just keeps PRESSING. And finally... the man's eyes film over. He dies. Steve just KEEPS PRESSING. Locked. Horrified. Staring into the dead man's face. Finally, he rolls off. Flops back against the wall, broken, bleeding, weeping... He SCREAMS. From the heart, the guts, releasing EVERYTHING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop sitting at the woman's dining room table. Carefully, she comes and takes the seat opposite him. No pretense. The professional, not the actor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Bishop. You okay? He stares into his wine. Raises the glass to drink. His hand shakes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you remember, what you wanted to be, when you were a little girl? She hears it, it wounds her. Looks down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, I didn't mean... I was thinking of me. She looks up, clear eyes. She's tough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's okay. I wanted to be a Marine Biologist. I used to watch those Jaques Cousteau movies and just... dream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was beautiful. He hears the simple truth of it, nods, respectful. He rises and goes to the music box on the mantle, takes out his wallet and removes the twenty $100 bills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry about it this time. On the house. A beat. Then he slides the money under the box as before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We all gotta make a living. He leaves, grabbing the doll as he goes. She watches him go, strangely. Sadness breaking through her cool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bell jingles as Bishop pushes in, holding the large Luna Cromwell doll. The Grocer looks up, smiling as he sees Bishop, then confused as he takes in the doll.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of delight as Sophie appears, running, grabbing the doll out of Bishop's hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, thank you! Bishop! Mom!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! She takes off back into the living quarters of the house. The two men exchange looks, uncomfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw that in a... I'm sorry, I probably should have asked. A small beat that says "Yes, you should have."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry about it, Bishop. You have a good night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME - NIGHT Bishop pulls up in his vintage Cobra. Shuts down the powerful engine, emerges into the night and moves to his porch. The front door has been BLOWN OPEN by gunfire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME - NIGHT Bishop moves in silent, alert. He reaches down under his sideboard for his gun. REACTS as his hand finds nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) ...Can I ask you a question?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits on his sofa in the dark, head lowered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you surprised to see me? Beat. Steve reaches over, turns on a table lamp as he looks up. His face is BRUISED, bloody. His clothing, stained and ripped. In his hand, Bishop's gun from the sideboard. Bishop TENSES, doesn't react. Steve spits blood, smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guy owns a watch-store, yet keeps a million dollar apartment. Supposedly sits on his ass all day, yet takes stairs double-time. (BEAT) It was sitting there, right in front of my face, wasn't it? Bishop doesn't respond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was that the man who killed my father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a code, to what we do. It may not be rational, but it matters. The man's name was Harry Xiao. He was a Mechanic. Last year a US Representative died in a fire... along with his wife and two children. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A few months ago, a CEO vacationing in Costa Rica was found dead with his wife. Because the woman was tortured, the authorities believed it was drug related.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop! -- BISHOP Civilian casualties are very effective at hiding intent, but there's a line --- STEVE I don't give a damn about that! You haven't answer my question: Did he kill my father? Bishop doesn't react, then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should put that behind you now. Steve nods, swallowing emotion. Bishop starts to move and Steve is suddenly there, still angry, pointing the gun right in Bishop's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could have died today!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blind fucking luck! Look at me! You tried to kill me! That man was... he was unstoppable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you stopped him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you! You sonofabitch! Give me one good reason I don't blow you away right now! ONE GOD DAMN REASON!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop SLAPS the gun away, PINS Steve up against the wall. Cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now I'm sorry if you got a little scared. But this isn't coaching girl's softball, is it? This is life or death. Every time you go into this, somebody dies. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every time, it's you or the other man. So stop your crying. He releases Steve who falls to the floor, sucking air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got what you came for, congratulations. You're done Go back to your friends, your women, your whole beautiful life. (POINTING) That used to be my front door. Try to close it on the way out. Bishop starts to go. Steve's words stop him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop. Those things... they don't mean anything to me. This, makes sense. I don't know why. But I think I was meant to do this. (BEAT) And like you said, you could use someone. Bishop studies Steve a long beat. Shakes his head, goes into his study. Steve follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop fires up the computer hooked to the printer. He glances over. Steve is standing in the doorway. Bishop tosses Steve the jump-drive. Steve studies it, slots it into the computer. Almost instantly, the phone rings. Bishop punches on
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The same silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should all be so lucky. The phone goes dead. The light on the drive turns GREEN. Bishop's PRINTER fires up. It starts printing out pages...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and STEVE. Watching the pages feed out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A new Mark at an elegant gathering of powerful men and women. Tall, powerful, entitled. His arm around a Turkish beauty in an elegant black one-piece. Emerging from a limousine at a large public event. Security EVERYWHERE. The same beauty on his arm. Charts. Height, weight, medical history. Bank accounts, figures. Leases, deeds of property.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Peeling out of the printer... THE WOMAN, the beauty, in a diplomatic power-suit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A second to realize: She's the mark. More pictures, we've seen this woman on television recently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: reacting. Then Bishop gestures towards the large empty wall, waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You get started. I'll make coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop... Nemesis. Devine Retribution. ...What did she do? Beat. Unsaid questions asked, unanswered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Okay. Forget I asked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seen through 30x telescope. The images MAGNIFIED, FLAT. The view unstable, moving. Just the low SOUND OF WIND. Panning over upper-floor windows, hesitating on a pair of armed security, making their rounds. Camera "clicks" then move on. Finds the ENTRANCE. A line of people moving through a metal detector. One young man in particular...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve collects his cell phone from the other side of a metal detector, slots a bluetooth and heads in. Bishop's voice fills his ears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Slow down as soon as you get inside. Security station will be to your left... Steve passes through a door, pauses as two guards talk in the open doorway to a security control room. Monitors visible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (CONT'D) How many views?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (eyes moving fast) Sixteen, no, eighteen. Four second intervals. One of the men notices Steve who starts forward to ask a question. The man points him down the hallway towards the consulat's reception. Steve's eyes track monitors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make that four and a half seconds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop is sighting through a camera affixed to the telescope, headphones on. He's on the 14th floor of a skyscraper under construction. Cement pillars and steel-work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) These guys are packing Israeli-made Uzis. Couple are actual military. Bishop takes in the other buildings across the street, then moves his sight up the embassy, adjusts a control
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Large tinted glass windows suddenly turn transparent. Bishop scans, find The Mark's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the bed watching TV, bored. He scans again... finds The Mark in the adjoining room, on the phone and ANGRY. Bishop touches a switch on the telescope and a small LASER projects. The woman's voice fills Bishop's headset:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, we're literally locked in here. I'm supposed to be presenting at the UN but I can't do that if everyone is going to panic about security...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop's scope zoomed in TIGHT on the Mark, staring at herself in the bathroom mirror. She's brave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...This is America. People don't just kill people here. Then she shuts the door. Bishop moves his focus upwards to a glassed-in terreriam-like structure on the rooftop. An indoor swimming pool. "Click." "Click." More pictures.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SAME pictures, now tacked up. MOVING over the wall. Meticulous study, days of work: BLUEPRINTS of the building. Service corridors highlighted, surveillance cameras marked, pictures tacked to locations. Magazine and newspaper clippings about the Mark, showcasing her beauty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Headlines: "The new (and beautiful) face of Turkey." "The face that said "no" to America." Other materials: Doctor's reports. Time-tables, intervals circled, holes noted. Steve and Bishop studying everything. Bishop, almost trance- like. Steve pacing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Work it again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She never leaves. It's like they know we're coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe they do. Steve nods, continues pacing, scoops up Bishop's cat and strokes her. Bishop watches him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Falls off the rooftop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Falls or jumps? Steve moves to the wall of pictures, his gaze lingering on shots of her on vacation is a swimsuit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tell you one thing, killing her is not the first thing that jumps to mind... what? Bishop HEARS this, frowns, moves forward. His eyes scan: The Mark at the pool, getting ready to swim. The security...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. I'm going for a run. You wanna come?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me ask you something. You ever not feel like running 5 miles?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishops sprints/runs through the woods around his house. Body pushed to limit. In his eyes, his mind somewhere far- off, working...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME - EVENING Steve, alone in Bishop's home. He moves from room to room. He hits the kitchen, looks in the fridge, makes a face at the empty shelves, the bottles of supplements. He moves on, pauses to stare at the gas fireplace in the study... moves on towards Bishop's bedroom, takes in the king bed. Runs a finger across the headboard, dusty. He STARES at the large painting across from the bed...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) You like it? Steve REACTS. Didn't hear Bishop come in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Feels disturbed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Always made me feel... understood. (BEAT) Come on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve follows Bishop to the wall of research on the female mark. Bishop points to some OLD RESEARCH on the Mark, glamorous. She was a model.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mark is a beautiful woman. Before arriving at her current position, she enjoyed the way men looked at her. That's gone now. She needs to be taken seriously. She hates that men only see the beauty. Magazines, heads of state, all focusing how what a piece of tail she was. Like you did. Steve SQUINTS... Bishop slaps a picture of the pool, the Mark swimming. Two SECURITY AGENTS positioned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why is he standing here? Wouldn't he get better coverage... here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...He can't see her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can't see her. Neither of them can. Beat. PHONE RINGS. Bishop snaps it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Hey, Bishop. Catch you at a bad time? Bishop doesn't respond. Waits...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (CONT'D) Always the conversationalist. Anyway, just calling to say we'd like you to go ahead with this one. As soon as you can. Click. Phone goes dead. Bishop hangs it up. Steve looks at him, anticipating... Bishop nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice downtown joint. Businesspeople dine. Second-story tinted glass looking out over downtown. TRACKING over faces, laughing, drinking, relieved to be done for the week... Finding Bishop, sitting alone, watching the people. The flirtations, the animosities... He looks down at the street below where a UPS driver has exited the building. Steve breaks the frame, sits down across from Bishop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Run it again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Patrol number three moves down the service corridor at 18:50. Five minute window after to make it up top. Three minute climb to position. That's 18:54. Three minute window to engage. Shake, stir, add lime and enjoy. Bishop smiles, looks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd you get into it? Bishop looks back, surprised. Checks his watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...This business, it's not like there's a degree you can go get. It's like most trades, it gets passed down. (BEAT) (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My father was very good, better than I'll ever be. But no one controls 100%. The nature of the work is that some people know who you are and what you do. (BEAT) A man told his girlfriend, to impress her. The girlfriend told some people she owned money to... Bishop finishes his glass of water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was young. It took me four months to find the people, another to find the girl, and she gave me the Man. That's how I... "got into it."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ever wish you just... walked away? Let it go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Every day. But I wasn't wired that way. (BEAT) What about you? Beat. Steve and Bishop, oddly locked... BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! Three SMALL EXPLOSIONS in the kitchen. FLAMES shoot out of the galley. A cook stumbles out, on fire. A waiter douses him with water. People SCREAM! Alarms BLARE! Steve and Bishop. They haven't moved a muscle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here we go... And they're MOVING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: takes a call as another man studies his monitor: People fleeing the building across the street, smoke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fire in the restaurant. (into radio, Turkish) Patrols two and five, we're closing down the front entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MARK stands at her closet, starting to unbutton her shirt to change for her swim. She pulls it closed as one of her security knocks and pushes into the room from a balcony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, 'mam. There's a fire next door, nothing to worry about. The Mark nods. The man locks the door behind him, crosses the room, leaves through the main door, professional.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve and Bishop push UPWARDS through a stream of people flooding DOWN the emergency stairs. They reach a heavy door, locked and alarmed. Beat. Three people burst out from the inside. Steve catches the door and they're through...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A few LAWYERS and a SECRETARY still collecting their things look up as Bishop and Steve push in, holding up badges.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! You need to get out! Whole building is going up! Bishop and Steve move on as the startled employees leave. They move down five doors, push into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A private office. Desk, computer, a handwritten note reads "Leave mail here, will be back Wednesday." A box from UPS which Bishop TEARS open. Inside, what looks like a large
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Steve goes to the windows, pushes them open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Changing its security pattern. Men are leaving posts on exterior patios, locking doors. Below, the excess manpower is channeled to the front. Bishop turns, FIRES OUT THE WINDOW. A Cable streaks across,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: into the wall of the embassy 30 feet away. Bishop
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the cable on this side, tosses the gun in the box. Steve seals it with tape, slaps a return label on it. He crosses the hall, tosses it in the MAIL ROOM. When he returns, Bishop's already secured the cable outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ready?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Steve hooks on as well, they're both wearing harnesses under their clothing. He steps out onto the ledge with Bishop, closes the window behind him. Bishop lets himself fall backwards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flashing light of the fire trucks. No one sees the two figures sliding silently from building to building above, disappearing over a 4th story railing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve lands next to Bishop who unfastens the cord they used to cross, spools it back to them. A look. No way back now, and no trace left behind. Jackets strip, reverse to the pattern of the embassy Security. A quick lock pick, and they slip inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elevator doors open and the Mark gets out. She nods to the guard on duty, heads into a changing room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two guards monitor screens: Corridors, rooms, entrances and exits. Pairs of guards make their rounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Something about them... The guard squints just as the image CHANGES, showing another part of the embassy. The guard hits a toggle, returns the previous image... But Bishop and Steve are gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mark pulls the straps of her swimsuit up over her shoulders. Stares in a mirror as she tucks strands of hair under a swim cap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quiet, lit from overhead by large halogen lights hanging from the hanger-like beam structure. Dark shadows in the corners. The low sound of water lapping, light reflecting off the water, moving over walls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Mark enters, and hangs up her robe. She goes to the edge of the pool, looks down into the water, then glances up at the GUARD who's stationed across the space. He nods back to her, moves to the lower space, giving her a little privacy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A second guard looks in, rudely checks out the Mark as she
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: into the water and out of sight. He shrugs, looks back out at the roof, lifting a cigarette to light... pauses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: an access door is open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mark swims, hard. Cutting through the water. She reaches the far wall and kick-turns against it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Her body passing above us. Silhouetted by the strong halogen lights above her. ONLY THE THROBBING SILENCE OF UNDERWATER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The indoor guard checks in on his radio. Looks up as the DOOR nearest him swings open. He rises, approaches the door, curious. Looks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The rooftop, lit by security lights, the strobing of the firetrucks below. Dark shadows. He hears a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a BANGING. Torn, he glances backwards. Can't see the Mark in the pool from here, but can hear her strokes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She kicks hard, dives under... And we're in her P.O.V. The far wall approaching, then we REVOLVE as she turns, now looking UP at the surface as she backstrokes to the surface,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: now swimming face up to the bright lights hanging from the girdered ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The second Guard tests the door. Seems fine. Takes out his flashlight and plays it over the roof. Sees nothing. We
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to find Steve there, tucked away, just out of sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The first guard reaches the source of the noise: A plastic bag, caught in a revolving air vent. He pulls it free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With the Mark, coming out of another turn, still backstroke, looking up. She makes it half way across the pool... pauses. She slows... floating, staring upwards into the light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lights. But it's like she senses something beyond them, puts a hand up to shield her eyes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!!! She opens her mouth to scream...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: AND BISHOP DROPS FROM THE CEILING, FREE-FALL, COMING STRAIGHT DOWN AT HER

direction.raw_text: ! He goes in, taking her with him underwater, his momentum carrying them both several feet under. She TWISTS in his arms, fighting. Screaming, bubbles FLOWING from her mouth!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . It's silent. No sign of the violent struggle going on below the surface.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Guard number one returns, glances up towards the pool. Doesn't hear anything. He sits back in his chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The struggle is violent, silent, terrible in it's inevitable conclusion. The Mark writhes and jerks but Bishop holds her tight, always pulling her away from the surface. Finally, the fight goes out of her. She goes limp in his arms. He turns her, stares into her unseeing eyes. Then lets her go, rising slowly to the surface.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Bishop just breaks, breathing in, silent. He raises himself slightly, sees the guard at his post.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The guard glances back towards the pool, hasn't heard anything for a little bit...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! BAM! BAM! A new noise from outside gets his attention again. He heads out, hand on his sidearm...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The guard approaches the same door Guard #2 already checked, banging in the wind. Open again. He starts to move towards it when a FIGURE looms, he almost draws his weapon, breathes relief when he makes Guard #2.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the second time it's come open. She still swimming?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two Guards come into the pool area. On the far wall, the shower is running, a towel has fallen over the drain and the water is flowing down and into the pool. One of the men steps forward, concerned...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh hell... The Mark floats face-up in the pool, just under the surface.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop has already shed his wet clothing, pulls on dry clothes as Steve comes into the room. They barely acknowledge each other, business. Bishop stuffs the wet clothes in a bag, dumps it into a LAUNDRY chute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did it go -- BISHOP Not yet. As if on cue, an ALARM BLARES. Excited voices come on over an embassy wide PA System. VOICES from the next room. Bishop opens the chute again as Steve cracks a glowstick, puts it between his teeth, swings his legs in, and DROPS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The door to the dressing room opens, armed guards flood in, along with Embassy officials speaking on radios. The room is empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tight, PITCH BLACK except for the eerie glow coming from the glowsticks Bishop and Steve have in their teeth. They slide
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the sides of the tube RUSHING up at them. And then suddenly a dim LIGHT at the bottom, rising fast...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve lands hard in a cart of towels. Rises and pushes himself out of the way just in time for Bishop who grabs the pack he tossed down, shoulders it, and they're MOVING again, now through sub-corridors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, you gotta admire that. You gotta admit, we are a spooky good team...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They PUSH through a set of old doors, move fifteen feet to a metal roll-down door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's like one moment we're there... the next moment... He ROLLS UP the door. STARES at a NEW WALL OF CEMENT BRICKS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...we're fucked. Bishop takes in the problem, starts to solve it. He tracks left right, considering options...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There wasn't any sign of this on the plans. I went over them fifty times!! This isn't supposed to be here! This can't be here! Bishop holds up a finger. "Shhhhhh" They LISTEN. A soft "beeping." Both men PEER around the edge of the metal door to where a small box with a red light BLINKS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop... what do we do!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Duck... Steve looks at Bishop and BOOM! Doors BLOW OPEN, THREE GUARDS burst through, machine guns raised and SPITTING... Steve hits the deck. Watching Bishop, it's like everything we've seen so far was in slow motion. This is the real thing, unleashed. Bishop WRAPS the first man up, uses his Kevlar vest as a shield to catch the fire from the other two. The man SCREAMS as his arm breaks. Bishop gets control of his weapon, focuses it on the other two. One is BLOWN back. The other
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: for cover. Fluid, Bishop REVERSES the man, pushes him AWAY from him, coming up with TWO of the man's Flash-bangs in each hand. Each hand DIALS the grenade's timers to two different settings, simultaneously POPPING the levers. Second attacker FIRES a burst which Bishop DUCKS, the bullets stitching across the first attacker, SLAMMING him back, his rounds TEARING into the ceiling, showering Steve in debris. Bishop THROWS the first grenade which reaches the attacker just as he rises for another shot. BOOM!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Another down as ANOTHER ATTACKER dives through the door at Bishop who wraps the man up, his fingers finding pressure points on the man who goes limp in his arms, dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . On the floor, witnessing everything. Even in the chaos, recognizing the move. Bishop SHOVES the last grenade down the front of the dead attacker's clothes, wheels him around, PRESSING him against the concrete brick wall... ... TWO more Security kick open a door, guns fire! Bishop goes horizontal, his legs CRUSHING the one man against the metal Grate even as he returns fire at the other two who fall back and BOOM! The grenade goes off! Bishop is HURLED against the far wall. SMOKE AND DEBRIS fill the space. Bishop MOVES, hauling Steve to his feet and shoving him into the ragged hole blown in the brick wall even as bullets trace after them. A bullet catches Bishop in the side, he sprawls, then LEAPS towards the hole...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cover in the floor is tossed aside. Bishop and Steve emerge, move 6 feet to a non-descript Buick. Climb in. The keys are waiting, Bishop starts it up, drives up the ramp. Next to him, Steve is catatonic, lost. As he drives, Bishop
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a strip from his shirt, pads the wound in his side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! Hey! You still here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...It was my fault. I was in charge of the exit. I looked at every work order, every entry in the building logs...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one controls 100% That's the nature of the beast. Steve swallows, nods as Bishop brings the Buick around a last corner, ACCELERATING at the closed gate in front of them, a Turkish guard waving his arms frantically...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Firetrucks and ambulances already crowd the streets. There's just no time or extra manpower left to react to the Buick which plows through the gate of the locked garage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two blocks behind, a single police car follows. Bishop takes a hard turn, moving FAST.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! You did good in there. You hear me?. It was asking a lot. You came through. Steve nods, processing, accepting. Another TURN. Bishop slides the car to a stop in a covered lot. Across from them, Bishop's own Cobra waits. Behind them, the police car tears by, lost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop drives down the small lane leading to his home. Steve is staring out his window, deep in thought. Finally, looks over. For the first time takes in Bishop's injuries.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're bleeding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Yup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So back there. That was one hundred percent? Bishop looks over, gives nothing. Tiny smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME - NIGHT Door opens and Bishop and Steve come in. Steve plops in a chair, head in his hands. A beat, and then MUSIC filters in. Neil Young's "Needle and the Damage Done." He raises his head, sees light glowing from the study.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop sits in a chair, eyes closed. Steve comes in, stares at Bishop. Looks over and admires the surface of the spinning record...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think you know it, when you've made the mistake you won't survive? Or will it be like the Marks? Wake up on top of the world, never know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Steve glances into the open cabinet where Bishop keeps his vinyl, FREEZES. Comes out with an signed album.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Oh my God. This is a signed Hendrix Axis, 1967 release. This has gotta be worth... we have to play this. You have to play this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shaking head no) That one... is for a special moment. Haven't found it yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You haven't found the... Are you kidding? You have to -- what? Bishop's eyes SHOOT open. He looks out the window where a series of SEDANS are pulling up. Men get out, approach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This could get... interesting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME - NIGHT Bishop steps out of his home. One of the several men there steps forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Bishop? Mr. Dean would like a moment of your time. Off Bishop who... nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sedan pulls up, Bishop is escorted onto a private jet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME - NIGHT Steve stands in the middle of Bishop's home. Home alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve stares at the classic vinyl on Bishop's turntable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve, wiring his IPod to Bishop's stereo. Nine Inch Nails' "Piggy" comes blasting out, insults the speakers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve moves to the bedroom, STARES at the haunting painting. He reaches forward, takes it down. Nothing. Blank wall behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve blasts in, lights glow on, illuminate the wall of research on the Female Mark. He goes to the gas fireplace, flames flicker up. Steve RIPS down the pictures of the woman. Moves to the fire and feeds the first one in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: watching. His eyes... Tracking to the side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Down, below the fire, stuck to the side of the interior cavity... a scrap of paper... Steve kills the fire, reaches in, carefully removes the scrap of paper. A corner of a photograph. A few buildings, distant, out of focus. Almost nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop, shirtless, stares in the mirror. He checks the wound in his side, splashes Vodka from a handful of mini bottles, painfully re-wraps the wound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop emerges from the bathroom, peers out at the grey monoliths of Washington D.C., below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gray morning. Wind blows. Steve stands alone, holding the scrap of photograph, now in a plastic envelope. He stares at where the chalk line has almost completely faded, then looks up, taking in the views, vantage points. A half mile away a building under construction rises high.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop steps off the plane. Another sedan and driver waits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THROUGH A CAMERA: The McKenna Holding Corp building. Image focuses on the rooftop, shutter clicks. Steve lowers the camera, looks at the display. He removes the scrap from Bishop's fireplace, compares it... the same buildings in the corner of the frame. Perfect match.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . No remaining doubt. Bishop killed his father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R. The SECURITY PROFESSIONAL is up here with Steve, hanging back. Steve nods to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do it. I don't care what it costs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SEDAN - MORNING Driver pulls the sedan to a stop in front of a large nondescript building. Bishop steps out, alone on the street, passes through the morning commuters, and goes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop passes through a SECURITY CHECKPOINT. Post 9/11, hyper-conscious. Metal detector. Smart guards backed up by battle-ready US Marines. Bishop collects his ID, waits for a door to "click" open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop sits in a fluorescent lit room, now with a bar-code badge on his coat. A few other people also wait. Bishop checks his wound, pulls his coat closed to mask where blood has stained his shirt. A door opens and a plain woman nods to Bishop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop sits in a chair. Through blinds, views of gray DC.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R. We realize that the plain woman is sitting across from Bishop, watching him. Finally, the door opens and DEAN enters. Pasty white, slightly balding. It's hard to locate where the sense of power come from, but it's there, innate. He motions to the woman who leaves. Dean sits at his desk, taps his fingers on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look like shit. (BEAT) How does Harry McKenna's son figure in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's going to be working with me from now on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure that's wise?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I need your permission?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... And for the record, I don't believe you'd ask for it. Dean grabs a remote control on his desk, points it at the set of flatscreens on the wall which hum to life, muted. News reports featuring the killing of the Turkish Embassador. Shots of the woman, smiling. Helicopter shots of the pool structure. Words scroll: "Terror on our soil." "Assassination!" "US Envoy ejected from Turkey..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (POINTING) That was my baby. But my baby has turned into an epic shit-storm and so when the man who caused said epic shit storm suddenly decides to do some soul-searching... (PLAINLY) What are you doing, Bishop?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The mistake was mine, not the kid's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Dean leans in, intense. Bishop watches the screens. A screen changes to a commercial for a Bahamas resort.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am on some very fucking thin ice right now which means you are on some very fucking this ice as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone I trained. That could be worth a lot to you. Dean laughs, rises with nervous energy and goes to the interior blinds, raises one. From here they can see out over the office. Glimpses of a dozen conversations. Other men and women at work. More than a couple glance over towards Dean's office. A predatory vibe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And here I thought we were both going to live forever. Bishop smiles. Dean stares at him. Bishop stares back. Suddenly, this becomes the moment, the decision...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, in this business, you only get one mistake. (off the flatscreens) So nothing more like that. You take full responsibility.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. The two men, face to face. Then Dean's phone rings. He turns to it, snaps it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Stanley. Yes, we're all sorted out. I just need you to -- BISHOP The hit, on the woman. What was the reason? Dean looks back, surprised, angered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm calling you back. Dean clicks off, takes in this change of rules. A dead seriousness infects his voice. Fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, this foul-up, McKenna's son, it's all got some people's panties in a real twirl. (BEAT) This isn't the time for questions. This is the time for survival. Everyone... is expendable. Beat. Dean turns away, picks up the phone again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (INTO PHONE) Yeah, get me Stan again...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve lays out by his pool, sunglasses, baking under the sun as his group of hangers-on swarm around him. Play, dance, splash. He's immune to all of it. Louise climbs from the pool, water drips off her perfect form. She nestles in behind Steve, her hands running over his body. He stares straight ahead, as if she didn't exist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, baby. What's the matter? Finally, something does catch his attention: At the gate, a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Van pulling up, the driver heading toward him. Steve lowers his glasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME - EVENING Seen from far away, the sedan pulls up. Bishop gets out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME - NIGHT Bishop enters, looks around. No sign of Steve, or any disturbance. He moves through the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve! Steve...!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop tense, in his study, holding the phone which rings... rings... Steve's voice comes on the voicemail: "Hi, this is Steve. You know what to do."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop, sitting on his couch. On the TV in front of him, images from a protest in Turkey, an American flag burning. Bishop's eyes flick to the stack of DVDs from the woman. No. He keeps watching the news images. His phone rings. He snatches it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) You're still alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seems that way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Hey, can you meet me? Something I want to talk with you about. Bishop, silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (CONT'D) It's important. Come up to the house. Please, okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop's sportscar pulls up in front of the large estate. Bishop gets out, surveys the grounds. Weirdly quiet. The windows of the house, dark. The grounds, empty. He moves to the gates to the back yard, finds them open. He pushes through, cautious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop moves towards the darkened pool area. As he approaches, Steve comes into view, standing by himself on the edge of the diving board in the center of the dark space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There you are. Thanks for coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's on your mind? Steve just smiles, shakes his head. Bishop stares at him, tense, confused. Each trying to read the other. Then Steve raises a bottle of whiskey to his mouth, drinks. Bishop takes a step forward and... ... LIGHTS WASH THE SPACE! Explosions! SOUND FILLS THE AIR!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Bishop ducks, rolls, his hand moving under his jacket... ... but not coming out with his gun. He takes in a surprise party, opening in front of him. Beautiful woman, LAUGHING, blowing horns. Men, pouring champagne. STREAMERS falling to the ground where seconds before they blew into the air, a large BANNER, illuminated behind Steve: "HAPPY BIRTHDAY ARTHUR!" And Steve, standing on the board, master of ceremonies, staring back at Bishop... oddly cool, dispassionate. Then he smiles. Bishop rises. Women come to him, touch him, put a party hat on him and give him small kisses with wishes of "Happy Birthday" as he moves to the pool edge across from Steve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not my birthday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When was the last time you celebrated your real birthday? No response from Bishop. Steve nods, swigs the bottle again. He's lit, something fierce and fiery in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See? You're overdue, buddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are these people?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They think you're a friend of mine, a producer, from Canada. (BEAT) In other words, they're all your best friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop sits on an outdoor sofa, surrounded by several gorgeous aspiring MODELS. Steve sits across from him, Louise under his arm. Bishop watches as one of the models ties a cherry-stem into a knot with her tongue, presents it to the group to a round of applause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what movies have you made?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, he makes the really violent, disturbing stuff. You wouldn't know it to look at him, I know, but what's locked up away in there... (tapping his head) Frightening, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, I love those. Which ones -- BISHOP Mr. KcKenna has a creative relationship with the truth. I don't actually... The model glances around, unsure...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, okay. That's funny. So what do you do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Mr. Bishop. What do you do? Bishop doesn't respond. He's just staring down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : Discarded, lying beneath the sofa the models are perched on: The tear-strip from a DHL Envelope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Mr. Bishop. We're all waiting. Bishop looks up at Steve who SMILES back. A beat, and then Bishop is up and moving through the crowd, pushing by people
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He almost runs into a bright blue-haired woman on the arm of a jockish RAPPER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me... He comes up short, realizes he's staring into the face of the Woman. She's utterly different than we've seen her. Tonight, she's the clubbing party-girl. Dark lipstick, bright blue wig, heavy eye-liner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi... This is strange. The Rapper she's with has found a group of his buddies. High- fives all around. He glances around for his date...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he your...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, just a job. (off his nod) I have to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. Go on. She nods, turns away. He also turns, starts moving through the crowd, pushing through DANCING BODIES... ... and suddenly she's back with him. No words. Lights and sound and dance around them. She leans forward, kisses Bishop once. Backs off, smiles, turns away and makes her way back to the guy she came in with who tucks her under his arm without missing a beat, mid-story with his posse. Bishop... staring. Turns away as the MUSIC STOPS. Steve's voice fills the outdoor space, amplified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ladies and gentlemen! The man of the hour!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hits Bishop. He squints up as the crowd makes space for him. Steve's near the DJ, speaking on a mic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know that not many of you know my friend. My good, dear... friend. I mean, he's a man of few words... And he's an art lover! Did you know that? His home is covered with work. It's amazing, what you can find in there. Amazing. A weird beat. Steve, smiling fierce.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Happy birthday, Arthur. Behind Steve, a covered object. Steve now turns to it, pulls the cover off a PORTRAIT of Bishop, clearly done by the Artist he collects. The image is twisted, vivid, disturbing. As the crowd erupts in APPLAUSE the ARTIST himself now comes forward, Steve's arm around his shoulder and bumping fists before the Artist heads on towards Bishop, shaking Bishop's hand. Faces BEAM. People CLAP. On Bishop, just looking at Steve who stares back... unreadable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop bangs out a door into the front drive, makes it to his car, fumbles for his keys. Sweating, off-kilter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Hey, you forgot something. Steve's there, holding the portrait. Bishop nods, takes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry... Sorry for leaving. I'm just not used to -- STEVE No worries, man. It's your party. You can leave it. (BEAT) It's true, isn't it? What you said to me the first time we met.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This thing we do. Finally, you always do it alone. Bishop nods unconsciously, starts towards his car, forces himself to stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve... thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-oh. I can feel some male bonding coming. We gonna hug it out, Bishop?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm serious. Thank you. People don't... Anyway, it's been a long time, since someone did something for me. Steve looks back, nods. Strangely dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Happy Birthday, Arthur. Steve raises a hand, shoots Bishop with a finger. A wink, and he turns and is gone, back to the party. Bishop climbs into his car, pulls away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop drives the car out of McKenna's estate, pulls out onto the street. He starts to accelerate away... then STOPS the car in the middle of the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Fighting what his guts are screaming at him. Losing it, POUNDING on the steering wheel. Suddenly still...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Party rages on, oblivious to the absence of its recipient. Suddenly faces turn UPWARDS... to where Steve is looking down on everyone from a third story balcony over the pool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you all having fun!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and NODS. LAUGHTER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I despise each and every one of you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Steve LEAPS out into space. Perfect huge swam dive... falling... HITTING the water. A moment of silence... did he? Was that deep enough...? Steve ERUPTS out of the water. Party ROARS back into life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: High above the festivities. Bishop slips over the wall, makes his way down towards the estate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dark and empty in here, party raging outside. Bishop enters Steve's bedroom. Messy, the bed unmade. A woman's underthings lying on the floor. Bishop surveys the room, checks drawers, peers down into the party below. He can see Steve in the middle of it all, Louise on his arm, his hand on her ass. Bishop moves to the office door, locked. He slides a pick- set out of his pocket, gets to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door lock "clicks" and Bishop enters, closes the door after himself and locks it, turns around... The room has been STRIPPED of everything that was in here last time. GONE are the paintings, the portraits, the mementos. All traces of Harry McKenna, removed. Instead, a SINGLE desk inhabits the center of the room, a small computer monitor and keyboard centered on it. Bishop comes around, touches a key on the keyboard. The monitor glows to life with a single "PASSWORD" prompt. Bishop stares at it. He sits, staring, concentrating...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve has moved to the edge of the raised patio, looking down into the valley. His eyes still, deep, impossible to read.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! Hey baby! Karen's got some amazing E. You need to come try... Steve turns those cool eyes on her. She shrinks. We think he might slap her, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me a moment. I'll be right there. We'll do that amazing E. And he looks away, back down over the view. A resigned loneliness settling into his features.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop, just staring at the password prompt which throbs in front of him. Beat. His eyes flick across to the few books lying on the desk. Weaponry, physiology... Greek Mythology. Bishop reaches forward, types "Nemesis." Hits ENTER. A moment... and then our minds are blown. The entire wall of the room in front of Bishop glows to life. It's a one large high-resolution monitor. On it, glows an infinitely detailed work-up on Bishop. A photograph on him glows at the center of the screen, changing every three or four seconds to another. This is Bishop's method, brought into the 21st century. Accounts, Medical charts, psych profile, associates, residence... Bishop approaches... takes it in. Touches "Accounts" and the window SPREADS OUT across the whole wall. Multiple windows, all of Bishop's money, displayed in real time, the numbers subtly changing with the flow of foreign markets. Another window above is labeled "Associates." Bishop touches this one and the financial windows are replaced with a collage of FACES. Not too many. We recognize the Store Owner and his Daughter. Steve himself. An older man "Gerald Bishop," Bishop's father. And a photo of the Woman. Bishop touches the woman and multiple images propagate out from the single. Many stills, but several are in motion, looping: Childhood movies. A commercial done as a teen. A blue movie when she was 20. Bishop's eyes settle on a video image: He and the woman, caught just an hour ago in the middle of the dancing party. The woman leaning to him, kissing him. Bishop stares at the image, then touches another image labeled "Residence." INSTANTLY, the images are replaced with images of the interior and exterior of Bishop's home. Bishop stares at them, confused. SQUINTS... realizing that in one of the images, the trees lightly sway in the breeze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh. His eyes dart to an image of his DINING ROOM. It looks like a still, until suddenly Bishops' cat passes through the frame. Bishops' eyes dart, moving from frame to frame. The whole interior of his life. His living room, bedroom, study, gym. All live feeds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son of a bitch...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Door BURSTS open, Steve pushing in, his arms wrapped around Louise and another gorgeous woman from the party. As the two women hit the bed, start undressing each other, Steve takes a moment -- sensing. Something not right. He pulls keys from his pocket, unlocks the study door, peers in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : THE STUDY - EMPTY LOUISE (O.S.) Come on, Steve. We need you.

direction.raw_text: Low end. Mean men and loose women. Metal on the juke. Duct- taped naugahyde. Bartender on parole. Eyes raise as Bishop pushes in, scattered focus, hits the bar.

direction.raw_text: Whiskey. Neat. Lots of it. Bishop fumbles in his pocket, brings out a thick wad of cash. $100s and $20s. Eyes track. At a booth, two EX CONS lock onto Bishop, one sporting a middle-finger raised FU tattoo on his bare shoulder. Bishop pushes $100 forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's too much. Bishop grabs the shot, down it. Pushes the empty shot and the cash back at the bartender.

direction.raw_text: I'm not going anywhere.

direction.raw_text: ...Intelligence services can listen to our calls. But what about the rest of the world? (MORE)

Miryem had always advocated for Turkish autonomy from
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to find the Artist's portrait of him, hung on the wall across, a surreal and distorted mirror. He chews his food steady, even, acutely aware he's being watched. We LINGER on the small camera eye tucked in the high corner of the room, staring down...

He moves forward to a paper that lists stats about Steve that includes a blank space for "Occupation:" Bishop fills it in: "Mechanic."

direction.raw_text: And you know, as much as I like the quality time, unless you can read lips, I don't exactly see what we're doing here...

Music and LAUGHTER filter in from outside. Steve becomes aware of the noise from outside, frowns.

direction.raw_text: . Steve levels the gun at her.

The images are pieced together, enlarged, skewed until nonsensical markings resolve into an address. Steve punches it into a search window, waits a beat, then eyes scan over the list of returns, lock onto something. He picks up the phone, punches a number. From the tube, an aluminum barrel holds a fishing rod. The rod is discarded, the barrel is attached to a hard plastic stock. AA Batteries are opened and slender shells are removed from each. As this strange choreography continues in silence, we PAN ACROSS to the dining room where a WOMAN and a MAN are bound and tied, pillowcases cinched over their heads. Their bindings allow them to hold each other's hands which they do, tight. They're terrified, but okay. Back in the living room, Bishop adds the last piece to the home-made rifle, a telescope, lifted from a child's gift box, snaps it on top of the rifle.

The rear section crumples against the building as the front section SKIDS down the building face, comes to rest against a GROCERY.

direction.raw_text: . Bishop and Steve recover, roll out of the now exposed rear of the driver's compartment and into
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: fruit catches rounds.

direction.raw_text: We have got to go! Steve's pointing at the rear exit. It looks far away.

direction.raw_text: You go for it, I'll cover you. Bishop takes in the exit, the gun in Steve's hand...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More COPS arrive, take positions. There must be thirty guns pointed in their direction.
