direction.raw_text: Bishop cranes around, tracks cop and SWAT...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry I brought you into this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not now, Bishop, we have to -- BISHOP It was... It was the only thing I knew how to teach you. Steve looks at him oddly, moved. Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry about it, Bishop. I brought myself into this. Bishop considers this, nods. And he's UP AND FIRING towards the SWAT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Clear shot at Bishop. A micro-second hesitation, and then he's RUNNING for the rear exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cops and FBI REACT to the shots, ALL open up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The WINDOW'S ERUPT in a hail of gunfire from the outside. Bishop hits the ground, rolls towards the rear exit. Bottles and produce EXPLODING under the assault. Steve reaches the exit, glances back to see Bishop on his tail, room being chewed-up behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve BLOWS down a corridor. A SWAT member suddenly comes out of as side-door, raising his weapon... Steve FLATTENS him, comes up with the man's weapon, reverses, lining it straight at Bishop... who hits the ground, as Steve
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rounds pushing back pursuing SWAT behind Bishop. More SWAT push in, shields raised, guns lined. Bishop SLAMS into them from the side. Pushes one through a door, breaks anothers knee as he disarms him, moves after Steve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve and Bishop emerge almost simultaneously, race up the alley as SWAT emerges behind them, rounds tracing after them. They clear the alley, onto...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pedestrians and shoppers crowd the small streets. Bishop and Steve tear through people on opposite sides of the street as overhead a helicopter clatters. Behind them, SWAT and COPS give chase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a van skids to a halt, SWAT pouring out. Bishop and Steve duck into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Travel agency. Displays fly as they muscle through to the back, then through service corridors, back into a RESTAURANT, headed for the front door...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: cars close from outside. Bishop raises his weapon,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: into the metal of the cars. The COPS panic,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: into parked cars. The cops piling out and taking position as RESTAURANT PATRONS scream and flee. Bishops checks his fire. PURE INSTINCT, swings his weapon to lock onto Steve who's also raised his weapon at Bishop. The two of them, suddenly lining weapons into each other's faces. Breathing had... eyes locked as beyond them another police reinforcement arrive, takes position... The SOUND of a cop, distant outside, CHAMBERING a round into a shotgun... Both men DIVE to the ground, roll even as they switch to single-shot mode to preserve ammo. BANG BANG BANG, they fire back at their attackers, precise, as the cops open up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Firing. Bullets find exposed legs and arms, men stumble back or fall to the ground, screaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Almost at the same exact moment, the men switch their aim back to each other. Both men, controlling emotion and body. Gasping for breath, bleeding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know? Tense beat. Glimpsed through shattered windows, SWAT arrives, takes the perimeter. They're being surrounded. Suddenly an SUV pulls into view between the restaurant and the SWAT and Police position, a confused and frightened WOMAN at the wheel. Police SHOUT at her, confusing her more. Steve makes a decision. Lowers his weapon, grabs a napkin, ties it to hide his features.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cover me. And with that Steve is RUNNING towards the outside...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ... BEHIND STEVE, Bishop steps out, gun in each hand. Clean shot of Steve's back. He opens up. Bullets tracing around Steve, pushing the men back just long enough for Steve to reach the SUV, haul open the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The WOMAN screams as Steve pushes her aside, takes the wheel. She scratches back, one hand ripping the bandana away from Steve's face. He STARES at her for one deadly second.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop FLINCHES as the sound of the SHOT come from the SUV. The passenger door opens and the woman climbs out as the SUV ACCELERATES away, cops and SWAT firing after it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The woman watches her car go, then turns and sits on the pavement. Her hand moves to her chest, comes away bloody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Angry like we've never seen him. Cold. Furious. The stupid waste of it all. He meets the woman's gaze. She dies looking at him. Helicopters clatter above, bullets plink into dishware and hardwood. Bishop just stares at the woman for a long beat, then he turns away, back into the building. It is... over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: approaches the SUV, slammed against another car. Shielded men throw the door open. It's empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: move into the restaurant Bishop was last seen in. Guns lined, checking corners. But there's no sign of Bishop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop enters the flat. Cool afternoon breeze blows through curtains. He stops, stares at the couple who owned the flat who now lie motionless. Small holes in the red-stained pillowcases over their heads. Steve has been here. Bishop swallows, angry. He forces himself back to the task at hand. Breaking down the never-fired weapon. He works efficiently, silently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop sits at the gate, waiting to board his plane. He watches families get ready, college kids laughing. On the silent TVs, CNN shows footage of the aftermath of the gunfight in the street. "Eight dead." A US Attorney speaking at a press conference.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Something is wrong in this country. But today because of the actions of a few cowardly men, we may never know the true face of -- A voice announces boarding, drowning out the TV. Bishop collects his things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grocer glances at Bishop's two grocery bags, then to the clock: 7:10. Sophie reads her book with her doll. A CAR speeds by outside. Sophie tracks it, looks at her father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME - NIGHT Key in the lock, Bishop enters, stands in his living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WAITING. Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bishop stands in front of his machines, still. Reaches out, touches one. Waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME- NIGHT Bishop sits across from the portrait of himself, finishes the last bite of his dinner. He takes the plate, walks into the kitchen and to the sink, washes the plate... His cat curls around his legs, purrs. Bishop takes a scrap off the plate, bends down and feeds it to her. She starts to eat, then her EYES NARROW... WHAM! Steve hits him from out of nowhere. Bishop sprawls as Steve LOOMS, gun lined!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Bishop hits Steve with the fridge door, knocks the gun out of his hands, it skitters along the floor. Bishop moves towards it, Steve swings a knife. Bishop catches the blow, but Steve HAULS down on the bad shoulder. Bishop SCREAMS as something gives, stumbles back as Steve swings again, Bishop turning, catching the blade in his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Bishop reels back against the wall as Steve picks up the gun and BANG! BANG! BANG! Fires as Bishop flees the room. Steve follows, keeping his shots controlled. Slugs chew into walls, furniture as Bishop dives out the front door. Steve advances, re-loading.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, when they came to me... I said "Are you sure?" Bishop?" But They're right, aren't they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME - CONTINUOUS Steve steps out onto the porch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...You don't really like the work anymore. Bishop's voice comes from the darkness near the barn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! BLAM! Steve SHOOTS as Bishop MOVES, finds cover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. That's... what did you call it? That's a prerequisite. (BEAT) Besides, I guess I had other reasons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it matters, today we killed the man who ordered the hit on your father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but not the man who actually killed him. Steve advances, clearing the side of the barn, LINES his weapon on Bishop, who's standing next to the barn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why'd you kill those other people?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shakes his head) You really going moral high ground on me? Seriously? You might want to check your soapbox there, partner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Steve fires just as Bishop SLIDES back, into the barn through a side door. Steve LAUGHS, slides towards the front.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CALLING OUT) But that's the difference between us, isn't it? You're all alone, but you still... like people. You wish they liked you. Whereas I have people everywhere... and all I ever want, is to be alone. Steve hears BANGING coming from the barn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no weapons in there, Bishop! I've... what did you teach me? I've controlled the situation. One hundred percent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The barn door blast outwards as Bishop's vintage Mustang come careening out of the barn at Steve... Who STANDS HIS GROUND. He aims, fires five times through the windscreen. The rounds IMPACTING Bishop as the car LOOMS at Steve who steps aside at the last moment, the car barely missing him, continuing on and IMPACTING against the side of the house... the propane tank. Steve squints and BOOOOOM! The propane tank ERUPTS in flame. Steve is knocked back. When he rises, the interior of the car is an inferno. The body is slumped against the wheel, the fire consuming him, cleansing him. Steve. Bleeding, bruised, victorious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME - NIGHT Steve enters the study, looking down at Bishop's record player, looks back at the wall of work on Dean. Smoke seeps through the walls, pushes through cracks in sills. Steve opens Bishop's record collection, takes the pristine collector's Hendrix. The one never played. He moves into the living room. FLAMES lick across the walls. Through the smoke, he sees the portrait of Bishop staring back at him. He raises the album in thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME - NIGHT Steve now stands outside Bishop's home, watching. The whole place is an inferno.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Pictures bubble and peel before turning black in the heat. The stack of DVDs melts, dripping down...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Flaming beams crash down, crumple classic cars. Steve watches it all. The fire reflected in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hot gorgeous day. Slight breeze blows through trees, ripples the water on the pool which is suddenly CUT THROUGH by the figure of Steve, swimming laps, hard. He gets out at the far end, looks over his grounds. There's no one here anymore. The place is deserted except for ear- wired SECURITY who patrol the grounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME - DAY POLICE and FIRE pick through the smouldering rubble. A DETECTIVE watches as the door to Bishop's fire-ravaged car is pried off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve trots in from outside, pulling on a loose shirt. The house is spotless, transformed. No sign of a frivolous young man's pursuits. Art and culture and wealth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME - DAY The door to the car gives suddenly, falls to the ground. The Detective pulls a handkerchief, puts it over his nose and mouth as he peers in at the body...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve busts in, dragging his father's 80's turntable with him. The portrait of Bishop has been hung here in his office. He glances at it, then breaks the seal on the Hendrix album, stares at the grooves before seating it on the turntable and hitting a switch. Player starts up, needle swings over... Steve moves to his computer and punches in the password. On the wall-sized screen, the Bishop research glows to life. All the connections, people, history that made Bishop. Bishop's cat jumps into his lap, purring, and Steve strokes her. Finally, a decision. He hits a button and the prompt
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ?" Appears on the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Needle comes down, touches the record, the sweet sound of Hendrix's "Little Wing" fill the world. Steve's finger still hovers over "ENTER." Bishop's cat jumps down, trots away. He watches the cat go, hits the button. The wall-sized screen goes blank. Just a cool white nothing. Steve SMILES, nods, leaning back... when a voice comes from the record player, overlayed above the song.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Steve, if you hear this, then it means you found the right moment to play the record. Good for you. It also means you had to scratch the needle across the surface of the record. Steve's eyes LOCK on the record player, the needle scratching across its surface, from the surface of the record, the smallest trace of smoke...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry it has to end this way. Steve's eyes dart to the portrait of Bishop. Its cold eyes stare back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The windows of Steve's office blow out of the estate's 2nd story.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BISHOP'S HOME - DAY The Detective, handkerchief over his face, leans over the body. Burnt beyond recognition. CAMERA moves away, down to the body's shoulder...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Every man has a death that's right for them. Every one. ... where a form, a heat shadow, has burnt into the charred remains of a shirt. A fist, middle-finger raised. We know this tattoo. It was on the ex-con who tried to mug Bishop outside the bar. This is not Bishop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) A death so right that when it arrives, those who knew him will say "Yes, this is right..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The detective leans the body forward, and the shadow disintegrates into ash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A brand new Maserati crests the hill, moving FAST. Brakes lock up, it slides to a stop in a patch of dirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...This was always going to happen this way." Bishop gets out. Shaved, healthy, clean. He climbs onto the roof of the car, stares at the highway which winds away into the distance. Freedom, laid out before him. He stares at it, wanting, needing. He blinks.
direction.name: direction
